Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash

zlNc1svQ7JOEUKK6cxjEow.text: We had a bad experience here.  We were celebrating a birthday and when we told the not-so-friendly waitress, she said...... Nice!  So I guess they can't give you anything for your birthday and then upon check out to pay the bill, automatically charged us a 20% tip.  We filled in another less amount, but got charged automatically 20%.  NOPE!!!  Not eating here again.  I'll go to Egg Works where they have an app that gives you perks and discounts.  Bye-bye.

1PLXnyKLBT6IeVeQZyI30A.text: I enjoy going to this breakfast lunch spot every so often. The coffee cake flavor usually changes and it is always super moist and tasty. Service is friendly and it can get crowded towards lunch time. Great for families and groups.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Blue cheese bacon burger.
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggs and ham.
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Coffee cake of the day is apple. Warm and fluffy.

bMbAj8TDVYw3_aMoKKWXug.text: Seasoned potatoes here are amazing!! Also there are a ton of different omelette variations that make each time I come here something new and not just the same old breakfast food over and over again.  I'll definitely be back!

5FqECs3wVysdpkGam9rc-w.text: I've had breakfast at The Cracked Egg on multiple occasions and nothing in that restaurant warrants the, at times, outrageous wait. On my latest visit I had The Garden Patch Omelet which had broccoli, spinach, mushrooms, tomato, and cheese. The omelet was around $10 and came out very dry, almost inedible if it wasn't for the pounds of melted cheese on top. The veggies on the inside were mushy and indistinguishable. The side of hash browns was okay, as was the toast... but a hefty price to pay for some toast and small side of hash browns. I picked at my omelet, and left over half of it un eaten. My previous visits here were equally unmemorable, but I got to catch up with lovely Jaime W here, so I opted to give this place another shot. I think this will be my last visit to The Cracked Egg though.

0ZGgxWDjajpM7XwTX_AvmA.text: Just simply the best, hands down. Great servers and food. The skillets are my favorite meal and the coffee cake is insane, sooooo goood.

x7ILuyJugsuEdGMZ0pTr8Q.text: my go to bfast spot out in the Green Valley area.   They have  a good variety of items on the menu so anyone can find something here to eat.  They have real hashbrowns.  Do you know how hard it is to find simple straight forward hashbrowns now days.  Geesh.   From their scrambles to their omelets, pancakes, biscuits,  or basic breakfasts everything is on point.  Wish their coffee was better but oh well, guess you can't have it all.  Service is generally fast and courteous even when they're slammed.

T_R0Nk2at2HgytIFM5UtLg.text: I just ate TWO generations of chicken for breakfast...BOO-YAH! Worth the wait which is only about 20-30 on weekends.  Good, quick, BIG breakfastes.

GqLtiA_8tg1ri_icLLp5zg.text: Great food, fast service, friendly staff. We were greeted and seated immediately. The food was great. I recommend the veggie Bennie or the pesto and feta scramble.  We had an awesome server with a big smile who made sure we were taken care of. All in all great food service and staff. U'll deff leave happy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

fEQM3-VoTIMrprIprQlHKQ.text: Came for brunch. Was seated and served to fast. Felt pushy but I  Enjoyed the food. Portion was more than enough and the coffee was dark and delicious.  Overall decent experience.

P07bV0QvXi4HexNMz5bg0A.text: I'm an omelet girl so the first few times I came here, that's what I ordered. Not my favorite. If you're looking for an amazing omelet go to omelet house. However, I love the cracked egg because they have a gluten free menu. It's so nice to be able to order toast or pancakes If wanted.  My favorites are the skillets and scrambles. The gluten free banana pancakes are on point! The service here is always short, sweet and attentive.  I think they do an amazing job with their hashbrowns. The seasoned potatoes aren't my style but my daughter and fiance love them. Eggs over easy are always perfectly cooked.

305v5tM81JU2MEe6fF5Z6Q.text: Try the country Benny and put some cholula on it. It's amazing. Sooooooooooo good! Also our server, Juan, was very nice and always coming to check up on us. 5 stars just for Juan!

snUBK0wEahq4bm177jDX0w.text: Service was ok, but I loved my California Omelet and there potatoes.  A lot of food, I couldn't fininsh it all.

R8kQZGhwHGltjnsrP1vHkw.text: Love this place! Today I had the multi grain pancakes with mixed berries, yum!

bFjwNdsF4GiTIcmRu9jrdQ.text: This place was crackin' on a Saturday around 11 AM, but we managed to sit at the bar, which was first come, first served, like most places.  From entering to leaving, the staff were really nice.  Our server was pretty good.  Even though you could tell she was pretty busy, she managed to be really nice and attentive.  I love me some good customer service and she did a really good job.  The host/hostess were cool.  They clowned my GF for accidentally running into this baby, knocking her down, and making her cry.  For the food, the coffee cake was really good.  Careful though, I think they throw it in the microwave to heat it up a bit, so the filling gets a little hot.  Really good though.  My corned beef hash was OK.  Not bad, but not that exciting either.  GF ordered some kind of enchilada omelette that wasn't very good.  It wasn't gross, but it just lacked flavor all around.  It just tasted like egg and cheese, basically.  The potatoes were addicting, though.  Overall, I think I'd give it another shot and order something different.  *No babies were harmed during this visit*

8ADWM4KT6lJUIyQJmkdXJA.text: Probably eat here at least 3x a week whether it's with friends or family. Can always count on great food and great service that's what brings me back.

B9Uz8nvJFREs5I5wJn0G7Q.text: Have not been there in over 2 years! We had the worst service ever in the history of a restaurant. Over priced and not worth it. Stay away.

Z-7Qj08hVgfIkG0Ei4JvEg.text: On a lazy Sunday morning you may see me and my family here.  We are regular Sunday Brunch patrons at The Cracked Egg.  We always come late Sunday morning, knowing there will be a Sunday wait and we are prepared.  We check in and then visit Popcorn Girl for a sample or two and walk through the pet store to see the latest gadgets (or just look at the same pet toys from the week before ...).  When we run out of things to do, we go back and wait for our name to be called while checking our Facebook or playing on our phones.  The time goes by quickly and we are seated in no time at all.  Our kids love the kids menus with crayons.  Since they already have their regular meals, they get to coloring while we choose between the sinfully delicious choices and the more sensible and healthy options.    BTW, when you are offered the choice of toast or coffee cake, try the coffee cake just once - YUM!  But don't think we are just Sunday visitors, we also come to this place for the occasional weekday breakfast or lunch.  We also often meet friends here for a much livelier meal.  This is Las Vegas' version of the local Sunday Brunch spot. Thank you Cracked Egg!

bcMCZtbiEizX3XpN4KYi_A.text: Good homestyle breakfast. You can tell by foot traffic it's a local favorite.  Diverse amount of items to order for all tastes.  Portions are on the large side,  so guaranteed to leave satisfied.  Scrambles, Omelettes, skillets and benedicts just to name a few.

x4wT53Racgwf__9LVaOraA.text: Not all it's cracked up to be!  This was our first and last time going. The service was horrible and food was mediocre! Drink order screwed up,  forgotten food (asked waitress twice where my son's food was) the only response was "F" bomb dropped and finally when paying bill the young lady at counter was so incredibly rude that another patron and I laughed and shook our heads. Over priced and over rated!

1kXyyCBZUFi_055jPpr1_A.text: Been here twice before and liked the food, the customer service was ok not the best. This morning was the worst customer service that we experienced, the waitress was pretty much ignoring us and helping the tables around us  not once did she come by. After waiting for a while without being acknowledged we decided to leave. At any establishment it's more than just the food but also the customer service they go hand in hand. Will never go back.

2Y_AV4upVtoaLNTG0bTPTA.text: Don't even think about ordering To-Go.  Overall, this place is okay. Pretty standard breakfast stuff (awesome coffee cake) and pretty standard service.  The glaring failure with this place is their absolute inability to correctly put together a to go order.  I say inability, because there can't be any other explanation for their 100% failure rate. I can only assume that there is some kind of medical condition plaguing the staff that prohibits them from grasping the concept of checking an order before they hand it off.   I work in an office across from this place, and I have literally had this problem dozens of times. Every time I think, "Ya know self, it's been awhile, maybe they have some new people in there now, maybe this time will be the time they don't suck". Nope. I guess the real blame lies with me, because I know better and I still keep trying. My bad I guess.

gl42BY6uQr3E_yGNtecmqg.text: Excellent customer service from the hostess to the server on a busy holiday morning. Fast, genuine and attentive. Food was warm with nice presentation. Frequent checkin's with "Is everything OK?" Scrambled eggs, omelettes, skillets, toast and potatoes all just right. Hot coffee kept coming. My out or town guests felt well taken care of and were impressed with portions and service. We lingered and tipped well as compensation... server came back and thanked us.

M2P8qHrwQW1AX3uo9rpQSA.text: Love their breakfast food. My boyfriend always orders the South Shore Scramble, I'm a sucker for their blueberry pancakes. They also serve the most delicious coffee cakes!   Not sure if we ever ordered anything that wasn't good on their menu...  Great place for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Peanut butter coffee cake!
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Posted in restroom
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Hung by the register. Lol

Wt2aFt8oKYjQnlRnk16U0Q.text: Food isn't too bad, but the service is pretty terrible. The two times I've come here, when I walked in, there was no one there to greet you or anything. There was someone at the register, just minding their own business, not paying any attention to the people who walk in the door. No sign telling me what to do... "Do I wait to be seated? Approach the person behind the register?" Seat myself??"  Once seated, the water and coffee (although coffee pot and water pitcher were only 20 feet away from us) took way too long to get. The server seemed so very apathetic about everything. No urgency whatsoever. Honestly the service would be the biggest reason I won't be coming back. The food was okay, but not totally worth the price.

PZaP0c3P3-ucnO9HFqZ_8w.text: The atmosphere was very nice. The restaurant was clean and the service excellent.  Our breakfasts were good other than the potatoes which were extremely disappointing for this type of restaurant. They were the previously frozen cubed type.

A3Cjj6QkQGmRpf3KYNzMSg.text: Foreign boyfriend wants huge American breakfast! Enter Cracked Egg.   Cracked Egg has the requisite American-style breakfasts. Massive omelets, scrambles, waffles, pancakes, etc. Literally huge portion sizes. Its like an upscale Blueberry Hill or Denny's. Place is a bit packed and incredibly busy. Service was good, but the noise level was a bit overwhelming. Although the food was good, I think the busy atmosphere is a bit of downer.

BVzHmYDvtWUCaNb5xj968Q.text: The cracked egg in Henderson- if you're looking for breakfast and you're in town this is the place. Gets busy during prime time but worth a 5 or 10 minute wait to get in. Prices are reasonable to proportion.  Food is always great but what gets me here is the service.  No matter how busy they get or how hard they work the staff is always friendly and going out of their way to make sure you're happy.

KV4mu-XYo6GCy6ezo4FZ3Q.text: I love the food here! My family eats here about twice a month, sometimes more. The food is always amazing. Unfortunately the service is really hit or miss. There are great servers there but there are a couple of ladies that really miss the mark. This morning in particular was very disappointing. There can be a wait to get seated but it's usually pretty short and the food is well worth it. Despite the sometimes lackluster service this is a favorite and I highly recommend you try it.

8jVmcB4c2TveMVFiq593vw.text: Visiting from L.A. and just happened upon The Cracked Egg so went in for breakfast. The food was very good and boy did you get plenty of it. Would definitely come back and also recommend it. My waitress Tori was wonderful. Very friendly and attentive, she made sure I had everything that I needed and kept my water glass full even though they were quite busy.  So nice to have a pleasant waitress and good food to start off the day in a good mood. Thumbs up to Tori and The Cracked Egg!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

aSmXr3DlaZFHeRHeSKAbww.text: Love the egg whites scrambled with turkey and diced green chiles!  YUM!  The server, Juan, is fabulous!  ;-)    Will have to try other scrambles at future visits!  I'll be back! :-)

7mogPKLuGngo9dzNisBKGQ.text: The Yelpers who have yelped before me got this review spot on. To keep it simple...  -The food is DELISH here. -The service is pretty bad.  We waited about 10-15 minutes after being seated to order or drinks.. not to GET our drinks, just to order them. Another 5 minutes later we finally got our drinks. When we needed refills it took a bit, had to wave at the server to get attention a few times. Takes a while for the food, but once you get it you forget about the service. Yum!  I ordered the croissant breakfast sandwich with hash browns and I was in heaven. People I was with got the Greek omelette and the Nutella filled french toast, both were pretty good, according to them.   I would definitely go back here, but because they are only open for breakfast/brunch there can be quite a rush. Next time I'll be sure to go earlier, maybe service will be better if the crowd is a little smaller.

gUuJPBTSGDgGteTruCMNww.text: This is my second time at the Cracked Egg (Henderson Location) and the first time all I could remember was the fact that the food was delicious; hence my desire to make a return trip.  Walking in to the restaurant with my mom we were greeted by the cashier and told the wait would be 5 minutes; no problem. When my name was shouted (as if there was a fire mind you), the "hostess" snatched the silverware and menus and raced off to the table.  She did not so much as look back to see if we were following her, nor did she even say anything to us as we were seating ourselves. Why? Oh yeah, that's because she was already back at the hostess stand before we even pulled our own chairs out.  This atrocious moment in customer service left an extremely sour taste in my mouth prior to even being helped by our server; who's service was also sub par.  Thankfully the food was the only redeeming quality and the friendly cashier guy.   I thoroughly enjoy the eats at the Cracked egg however we will not be returning to this location again.

ofJXpBETNn08ZJKX6QNhfQ.text: On of my favorite breakfast spots in town! So glad there is one on the Henderson side, as the only one I used to know was way north west.   Cracked egg has an interesting variety of egg options and fantastic pancakes. On top of the Joey Scramble I just had to try the Oreo pancake special. It's loaded with Oreos!!!!!  Of course there was no way I could finish all of this so I took it home and it tasted just as good the next morning!  Can't beat the cracked egg with their specials, skillets, and salads!   Service is always just fine, food is prepared quickly and it's always clean.

PI3ZBDLAQEy5tqHB1znqew.text: Classic American Breakfasts.  Had the Benedict, non-traditional with spinach and tomato, a great choice.   Way better than a Denny's or Coco's but they could be used as an example of what corporate/franchise America would do to this place given the chance.

KjN_pEus5bC2rkMsK3X7lQ.text: Mediocre service, long wait for food after order, non friendly staff.

gD_EsnmrmcIVHWsu5rBugQ.text: One word...UNDER-SEASONED!  We ordered the following on a Tuesday at 10:15 AM: 1.) Californian Omelet-has bacon, avocados and cheese.  Under-seasoned. 2.) Homemade Corned Beef Hash-Had to add salt.  I asked for a side of rice, but sadly, they don't make rice there.  C'mon, I am Asian.  I love rice with Corned Beef.  But that is not the reason why I gave them only 3 stars.  I asked the waitress to have my egg scrambled over easy, it came out non-scrambled, over easy. Under-seasoned.  We chose the seasoned potatoes, the hash brown, and the coffee cake to go with our food.  The coffee cake was warm and moist, with cherries at the bottom.  Tasted delicious with the coffee.  For the hash brown, I asked for it extra crispy, but didn't come out to how I would like it to be.    If I come back, I will probably just order the coffee cake and a cup of coffee.

NcGMW4ZM2yBNx0cCS9yGQw.text: Great experience!!!  The service wasn't the best, but it was super packed with Zapponians on a weekday morning to be fair to the workers.   I ordered the Californian Omelette that had bacon, avocado and jack cheese... so good. Be sure to order the seasoned potatoes! They put this cajun seasoning on top that's making my mouth water right now.. My friend got the Cracked Croissant and that looked even better my omelette, definitely have to order it next time.   Zappos employees really hyped up the coffee cake but I found it too sweet to enjoy for breakfast, I'll probably go for the toast or other choice next time.   Great for breakfast and brunch, I'll for sure be back to try more!

Nceb6wXzzrbY_0SpigspTA.text: I really enjoy this place every time we go in for breakfast. Their coffee cakes are perfect to satisfy that morning sweet tooth and that coffee if strong enough to wash it down. Busy busy but worth it.

FUZjxrlb1E160Lj0uuFSQg.text: Very nice little breakfast/brunch place. Reminds me of Omelet House. Ordered the Cakes and Eggs breakfast, which came with banana & chocolate chip pancakes (extra surcharge), scrambled eggs, & bacon. Also ordered coffee, which was pretty standard.   Portions are pretty large, and it's a nice place to go to with a couple people or a large crowd. Parking seems plentiful too. Service was kinda whatevs, but our food came out pretty quick.

os6heAgNeZbzlDJRGoHENw.text: A gluten free diner's gem in Las Vegas! This place was SO good that we went to 2 out of their 4 locations while on vacation over the weekend. This location in particular was our second stop at a Cracked Egg location.  There was a bit of a wait at this location on a Sunday, but they still moved the line pretty quickly. This location also has a great outdoor patio dining area which unfortunately was full. We waited for no longer than 10 minutes and service was super-fast and friendly! Tip: If there is a long wait, you can sit at the counter and not wait at all. Another plus about this location: our meals came out really quickly! So quickly that even our waitress said it was quick! Given that we were famished, we definitely appreciated that.  Having been through the drill at their other location, I requested the gluten free menu and was excited to try yet another meal here. SO many gluten free breakfast options! Choose from scrambles, to omelettes, skillets and gluten-free pancakes.   At this location I tried the Lighten Up scramble which consisted of egg whites, with turkey, diced green peppers and a side of salsa. All eggs come with a side of hash browns or seasoned potatoes and gluten free toast! I was glad the server (as well as the menu) mentioned that the bread was toasted in a non-gluten-free toaster; however they will happily grill it for you to avoid contamination. The scramble was delicious - the ingredients tasted really fresh and light. I ordered the hash browns again because they are so darn good - perfectly seasoned and crispy!   My husband who does not have any dietary restrictions also loved this place, especially since they serve you a huge chunk of warm, delicious coffee cake with your eggs!   Will most definitely return here if ever in Vegas again - especially since I saw that they also have gluten free lunch options such as burgers and sandwiches.

3ZlAsShkxmA89KLRKQCn9w.text: Took my dad to the doctor. Use the map app to find food places nearby. The cracked egg popped up, &  had good reviews, so we decided to go. We had no wait time, it was about 11:30 A.m. only one couple In of us, we were seated right away. Based on the reviews we chose the coffee cake for our choice between toast and coffee cake. It was hot and delicious & had apple inside. Coffee went well with the coffee cake. We both had eggs and ham. Overall breakfast was delicious, and the price was fair. Will definitely go, if we are in this area again at eating time. Will recommend to friends and family.

PXK5qsEjSkfXburay7Vxxw.text: If you're into breakfast, this is a good place.   We went on a Sunday morning, and that was ill-advised. The place was packed with what looked like regulars, and we had a 20+ minute wait.   We were shown to a table and service was decent. Within a couple minutes we had our drinks and placed our orders. I got the Country Bennie, which is like eggs Benedict with country gravy. She got the Cracked Croissant, which is a croissant sandwich with eggs, cheese and such. Both came with better than average hash browns.  Both were very good. The portions are fair, and should fill you up. I had to bring some food to someone at home, so I ordered up a couple Monte Cristo's. They were good, but not as good as other places. That being said, Monte Cristo's are hard to find, and I'm glad they have them.  The coffee cake looks amazingly good, although I did not have any.  One tip: The price is fair, but I did notice we seem to be the only one paying without a coupon. They do seem to also be in the coupon mailer, so if you haven't tossed it out yet, and you're thinking about going to The Cracked Egg, you should look for the coupon.

-3ib1zGVCBjJ7U3wP15s8w.text: Delicious! Huge portions that definitely hit the breakfast spot! Worth driving away from Vegas for!

QN-iR8OGfw5u6dA-boWu6g.text: Always my favorite, food is heavenly and service is great. I wish they would come to my house and cook breakfast! I love the Greek omelet with egg whites...yum!!

1VBOMOLtxs7R9rsG9v4aQA.text: I thoroughly enjoy this place! I think it's the perfect Saturday morning breakfast spot. I go here a lot with my Mom and we absolutely love it.   I've never had any complaints about the food. The California omelet is my favorite. My only advice is, try to get seated before 9a.m. on weekends. Or else, expect a lot of noisy people, some annoying kids and lines.   You got this! Get there before 9a.m.

m-RcOcpZWPU1YaCiKtNJhg.text: Stoped by this morning for a quick breakfast around 9 am. Service was quick, food was served hot and with nice large portions.  Restaurant is very clean, a little noisy with everyone talking at tables  but was not bad.

lLZGl9MqoIXSaDGNblDepg.text: I like that The Cracked Egg is a locally owned business.  It's always nice to support locals.   Whether sitting at the counter (no waiting) or in the main dining area (usually a wait), I have consistently experienced good service at the Cracked Egg.  At times it's a little slow, but they get very busy during weekend brunch, so it's hard to find fault with that.  You'll find typical American breakfast and lunch fare here.  Not much that would pique your interest to venture off the beaten path; but sometimes you're just looking for familiar comfort food.  Their omlettes, scrambles, and bennies are all tasty and hearty.  Their burgers are juicy and flavorful, and their salads fresh and cruchy.  Their pancakes are good too, but they're no Dupar's or Babystacks.  The space itself is large and clean, but could really use a decorator's touch.  Side benefit of The Cracked Egg is it's proximity to Popcorn Girl :).

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Denver Omlette with fruit
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Kitchen window

gOAUOHBdNQRMyPJCtQIRvA.text: I can make better scrambled eggs!  Plus they are way too expensive! (and kind of slow service to top it off).

6blM7TB5SMEmWtw7SYvNdA.text: I really can't come up with any complaints about The Cracked Egg. Every time I have eaten here I am impressed by both the food and the outstanding service.  This location gets really busy, but I've never waited more than 15 minutes. They are experts at getting people in and out as quickly as possible. The servers come by as soon as you are seated to take orders if you are ready, but they don't rush you if you aren't ready. The food comes out pretty quickly after ordering.   The menu is huge with a nice variety of breakfast options. As the name implies most of the options are geared toward eggs, but they also offer pancakes and waffles. The omelets are made with three eggs so they are huge. Skillets are also filling options. The coffee cake that comes with many of the meals is moist and sweet. I'd suggest adding a side of coffee cake if your meal doesn't already come with it. I love that there are many options with a Mexican twist including chorizo options.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Coffee Cake

oEcNN-NEmwxrBN6DrsYnnw.text: Love this place! We come in at least once a week! Breakfast & lunch food is good! The kickin grilled cheese & the eggs Benedict are my two favs! Recently tried a salad & it was super big & yummy

fV6e_hjCby1o5P5jX49tGg.text: What an advertising genius buy lacked in every review I read and the menu design brilliant with large resteraunt busy as can be and had that local hang out...but service horrible, bisquick in a box, terrible coffee, and food undesirable

YdMmoTVxF9yd8bjNaFv0Kg.text: I wasn't expecting too much coming here, just a simple place to have some brunch before going shopping. The food was ok, nothing fantastic or terrible, just ok. I wasn't really pleased with having cold toast, though. But what really got me was our server. After we had finished our food and before our plates were cleared, our server brought a nearby table their food, then got in a conversation with another table and his back was to us. He talked so long that the first table FINISHED their meal and he was still talking, ignoring everyone else. All we wanted was our check. Finally a third table asked if he could please check on their food and he was not pleased at being interrupted. He informed her that he has other tables, not just her, and stormed off to the kitchen. Rude. And to top it all off, 30 minutes after leaving both my husband and myself (we ordered different foods and different drinks) were extremely ill. Gut wrenching horribleness. I doubt I'll go again, I'll find another diner.

mmmJ0UOVY1raOVCINvvIlg.text: This location is so much busier than all the other ones in town! The Cracked Egg is by far my favorite breakfast chain in Vegas. Now.. I love potatoes. If we go out to eat, I will have all my sides potato related. Hash browns are my favorite potato form.. When you come here GET THE SEASONED POTATOES as the side. Trust me. Don't ask. Just do it. It's so mouth watering.  Their country fried steak hits the right spot every time. The steak isn't huge, but isn't small. It's the perfect size. Now again.. Make sure you get their COFFEE CAKE. Yes. Do it. You can thank me later! Their corned beef hash is perfect but does get cold a little faster than I'd like. The big bad wolfe is their best omelette too. It's off a small menu so you wouldn't find it on the original one!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Amazing corn beef hash!

ZzXkiLEoniHcmPw8qdk7ow.text: This is our favorite breakfast spot. The service and food are both wonderful, and we have rarely had to wait (we go early). We have never had a bad experience at this location.

QW5yORFfIE6b5K0jHaclVA.text: Came it for a late breakfast. It was quite full but service was quick and efficient. Southwest eggs and a filly steak sandwich were exactly what we needed. Generous portions and very tasty.

IOKorfmrBALIlYAP2HvUEg.text: Service and food was great but it was a disaster when it came to paying. You pay at the hostess area. The credit card machine broke and I was waiting for 20 minutes for it to be fixed. They held my credit card hostage and wouldn't let me go get cash. They handled the entire situation extremely poorly. No one apologized for the situation, no one cared at all that this happened. They just started helping everyone that had cash while a lime started building for people with credit cards.   Once it was fixed, they helped every person in line except me. I was trying to get their attention because they were holding my credit card this entire time. I was seriously going to leave without paying because the service was so terrible I didn't want to give them a dime, but I couldn't because they were holding my card. I'm not even upset that the machine broke and the wait was long to pay, I'm just really pissed about how this was handled and how no one apologized or gave two shits about the customers. Not to mention the hostess screwed up the transaction of the guy before me and put someone else's bill on his card that was much hire than what it was supposed to be.   I hate to be a jerk and write a bad review for this place because the food is great but this specific situation handled poorly.

IdmRJdz5lQbsuvgzsMlWRA.text: Someone wrote a positive review about their eggs Benedict so I tried it. Edible but nowhere close to what it should taste like. Server was pleasant and attentive. Good coffee. I would come back and have something else from the menu.

ejIhUIu_emFxWVOjquE3Ig.text: Pretty decent breakfast and the wait wasn't that bad for a Sunday...tried the coffee cake that everyone raves about but it really didn't blow my socks off...very good but more like angel food/birthday cake than coffee cake...  Had the bacon cheeseburger scramble and they use loose ground beef which I wasn't expecting but pretty good regardless....  Service was prompt and the beverages we're good...overall I'd be back but only if I'm on this side of town.

0bnV1vI_31RgehVj9tw7mA.text: The Montecristo is soooooo good! So many people have referred me to this place and it took me a while to finally experience it, but i was not disappointed. Their fries alone are killer. Must try. Decent prices and good service.

-2PAe1bMCxULlidkRpfZkA.text: On Saturdays they have this AMAZING vegetable soup. I seen a lotbof people eating  breakfast but, I have not tried yet. I have heard it's very tastey.

rPF93SBt2-yOrYYkRyifWA.text: This place is amazing! The food was beyond delicious. The combinations are fresh. This place will put you in a food coma!

fulEzyYJEuBgAvCPMNbWeA.text: Just walked out.....sat with NO COFFEE offer while 3 other tables got seated, beverages AND ordered while NO ONE approached us.  Come on...you are abreakfast restaurant!!!!!!

pajMQSJC2mjl0RHdU7_TDg.text: Great service and great food and they always have coupons in the newspaper. I always get the North Shore scramble or Heurvos Rancheros. Yummy place for breakfast.

AN3nLmBeJ3q6R8yiyU3GnQ.text: I have visited The Cracked Egg several times and have waited a while to write a review.  This is mostly because this place is "meh" enough that I couldn't figure out what I thought about it.  Service is pretty poor.  One morning we brought my father here while he was in town for a visit.  We had to wait ten minutes for someone to even offer us a drink.  If Dad wasn't so hungry from his long plane ride, we would have left.  Even when we were finally served, the service left something to be desired.  My dish was cold and under-seasoned.    Some time later, I decided to give The Cracked Egg another try.  There are enough positive Yelp reviews that I thought maybe I just had an anomalous bad experience.  But the second time, it was even worse.  I asked to substitute egg whites in my skillet...when it came out with normal eggs and I asked to have it made correctly (very nicely, I might add), I received an audible groan in response.  The waitress acted as though it was a huge inconvenience for her to walk back to the kitchen.  The extra star is for the coffee cake, which my dad loved.  Other than that, I don't really see why I would visit The Cracked Egg when there are much better breakfast joints in town.  I won't be back.

cV7MRptcP8b-ng3TMI_a2g.text: I live at SW but went to this location. Good and fast service. I tried the pesto scramble and she tried the Lucy and we really liked it. The atmosphere was just kinda dark for a bf place. Would go back.

iyKnF3l-2-IK4u6cYggzPQ.text: Management soured my experience.  Typically I love this place, but usually eat at Egg Works (my friend prefers it)  However, I had purchased a Groupon to The Cracked Egg so I needed to use it.  The catch. I accidentally purchased a groupon that I could only use Mon-Fri.  Since I am always at work M-F, It ended up expiring.  If anyone knows anything about Groupon it states right on the page that the value you used to purchase the groupon never expires.  So I figured taking it in on a Sunday, at least I would be able to use the original amount towards my meal.  The server curtly told me that they would not accept it.  When I asked to see a manager, she came over with an attitude and refused to acknowledge my explanation or even listen to anything I wanted to say.  She kept repeating we will not take it.  I felt that she was incredibly rude and will unfortunately not return to this location because of her.  It is really unfortunate for me, because the food was absolutely delicious.  Probably one of the better breakfasts I've eaten.  But I refuse to go to a restaurant where the management will not even listen to what I have to say.  I also feel that it would not have effected the store if she would have honored the original groupon price.  Thank goodness for me I can still go to Egg Works.  They have always treated me with respect and smiles.

wXo_3KD2nyClvXKpZdY-Ig.text: Food deserves 5 stars. Service deserves 1 star. Mexican skillet was awesome. Sister loved the monte cristo sandwich. We were a party of 6 and no one in our party ever got their water or coffee refilled. Waitress (Vanessa, I think) never asked about our food. Would return weekly if service was up to par. As it is our return is questionable

fq2xq5MIUpgY6B9o4sMtXw.text: Friendly service and pretty good food definitely gets an A-OK in my book. Bigger portions especially when it comes to the "Big Bad Wolf" omelet would have earned an extra star or two. The omelet itself was stuffed full of meat but was small by all standards (took up less than half my plate and was half an inch thick).  Coffee cake was absolutely delicious so I am glad I read the reviews and knew to order it. Four dollars for orange juice was pretty steep when the entree itself cost ten dollars. Lesson learned though.   Overall 10$ for a small omelet and 4$ for orange juice leaves me wanting a lot more for the price.  I would go back for the coffee cake but that's really the only thing pulling me back.

Kha58qMx43q9I2RiHskHPg.text: I wanted to try this place because of the positive reviews I saw. And today i finally tried the place and was very disappointed. The food was mediocre. Service, horrifying. Staff is not very friendly. No eye contact. It just seemed like the staff did not want to be there. They have no pride in their restaurant either. There's trash on the floor and I watched the staff walk by it multiple times including the busser and no one seemed to care to pick it up. Additionally, our server seemed disinterested. She was not very genuine with her service. Made it a horrible experience especially when we are paying good money to buy cheap food. Pretty sure their food cost for French Toast is like 1 dollar and they charged it up to about 10 dollars. I gave it a two star because the food was OK.

0HtTHZFNc8ZPy7KEwT9U1Q.text: Gluten free Pancakes and toast. Sold. I'm a regular. Just ask for the special menu and you'll find almost all omelet and skillet choices are gluten-free.

SPO2a_S1vIn8E6LzC_K52w.text: The coffee cake is delicious, no doubt. Yesterday morning I had the carnitas omelet. Very bland and very light on the 'carnitas' part. Not my favorite meal here. Will not be back anytime soon. Can definitely find better and similarly-priced (if not cheaper) breakfast eats in town.

G-GvTA5wO9IRnS-X97mlPw.text: Went there for the first time with my buddy. Ordered waffles & eggs for myself cause I love those things. It was great. Server was pleasant.

EQaO_dIWHkg4bjdrQx0AnQ.text: Ordered a California omelette. The avocado was rock hard and brown on the inside from the pit. The peach coffee cake had a minuscule amount of actual peach in it. The coffee is good and service is friendly though.

AN7rJZvpKPfc_My5O_bv_Q.text: *4.5 stars. I've been here a few times and the food is always good :D The coffee cake is soo yummy! Awesome vegetarian options.

eoWNMDactquIgRIPBOTS2A.text: Well if you read my stuff ya know I like my breakfast this place won't disappoint the portions are large and tasty, and they bring you coffee cake with your coffee??? Or toast but  give me cake any day! I had the carnitas omelet the taste was bangin, love Mexican food for breakfast the flavors start the day the only thing I didn't enjoy as I am impatient, was waiting I go to eat I'm hungry don't want to set for half an hour smelling food as I'm hungry already, right? But the staff was  pleasant and the price not to bad so, well be back

YXGoSshPXXehCTf75zonKw.text: The manager gave me attitude just for ordering a water with lemon and didnt acknowledge when i said thank you for serving me my drink. The waiter was sarcastic and snippy, though it may be because of his managers bad attitude. The food is amazing, as always. But who needs attitude first thing in the morning?

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

kmAZSOLREofcmKkBTQgalw.text: I have never had anything but a wonderful experience here.  I ask for David when I can.  He's funny and quick and never misses a beat.  I've never had an order wrong.  The food is always delicious!  Don't order the same thing everytime.   They have so many delicious menu items.  Try them all!

EeNM9BkZ2iB4_l_O5aUTXA.text: Salmonella outbreak be damned, I'm eating my runny yolked eggs anyway.   I went to the Cracked Egg around noon on Sunday and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. My plan was not to eat too much because I knew I had to save room to stuff my face at the M buffet later that evening. After reading all the reviews about the big portions, I split the croissant sandwich and seasoned potatoes with my mom. It was definitely a knife and fork sandwich especially because I ordered the eggs over easy. There's a reason why you can't get an over easy egg mcmuffin. It was a delicious, cheesy mess.  I particularly loved the seasoned potatoes, which were super crispy. I can just imagine eating a whole plate of them with gravy! The bf also raved about the hash browns, but I think the seasoned potatoes were better. I also had a bite of my dad's coffee cake which was a bit too sweet for me. It looked like a cornbread square and was less dense than the coffee cakes I'm used to.  Overall, definitely a good place for breakfast or lunch. I mean, even in Vegas you can only eat so many buffets afterall...

IHq0dbteI8U6lhocpjBdZQ.text: First time here and I will return next time in Vegas.  Really good place for breakfast.   Highly recommend this place.

igFG-mR2nNc6Iriq4EWDfw.text: Being new to the area my wife and I were anxious to try this place. We went for lunch and both ordered off the sandwich menu. The food was prepared very quickly and looked nice but unfortunately that's really the only positive point of our experience. We both found our meals to be rather bland with the exception of our side salads and certainly not worth the $35 bill. To add to the disappointing meal was the appearance and less than friendly staff. Employees do not have be overly happy but a fake smile would have helped. When we went to pay the bill after leaving a cash tip, the man behind the cash register who was dressed in jeans and a white t-shirt with no employee identifying marks, seemed way to anxious for me to add a tip and even offered to fill in the reciept for me.  Maybe we just caught this place on a bad day but we will be in no great hurry to return.

CPhJ6I0oex_h06r5dxSfvw.text: If you are looking for good customer service this is not the place. It starts at the front door by the sour expression on the hostess face and spreads through the restaurant to the servers. I watched one waitress deliver food to three tables snd not say a word to her customers.  Tory was our server and she was great.

RGzuqTTgIY6sHh3HmhEMKA.text: Walked in.  Took a quick glance.  Yup...we were the only Asian people there.  But that didn't stop me from trying to get my scrambled eggs, nor did the long wait and freezing weather outside.  Starting my morning with some coffee cake?  Count me in!  Starved and fatigue since the night before, this sweet beginning couldn't have come at a better time.    I knew I wanted some scrambled eggs but my rational mind opted for an omelette with vegetables, the Garden Patch.  It was a wrong choice as I was eyeing my friend's scrambled eggs the whole time.  Luckily I got to steal some and heavenly fluffy it was.  Don't get me wrong.  The Garden Patch omelette would have been a great hit if I were a rabbit.  Note to self - never put broccoli in an omelette.  Go for the hashbrown if you can.  If you get lucky, they'll brown it thoroughly and what you get will be a crunchy shreddy and starchy texture to play with in your mouth.  Definitely one of the funnest moments in my mouth.

WVaq7ckS0ymp_n-dznCtIA.text: Uhh... if you like cold eggs and bacon, this is definitely the place for you.   The hashbrowns were not cooked thoroughly enough.  A bit under cooked.   Prices? $23 for 2 basic dishes. Idk... is that  a good price  ya'll?    Anyways... im not interested

abf_7fU67wHwnVnu1emz8Q.text: We come here all the time and love it. Great menu and consistently fresh and delicious. Every single time we've come here we've had excellent service, but our server today seems to be annoyed. Everyone has a bad day once in awhile right? It's forgivable. We will come back as long as we live there because it's simple food, great atmosphere, consistently awesome!

N_LeHGI2wQSTt-8OwcuQ5w.text: We often visit with coupons mailed to us. Probably worth full price though. The breakfast has always been good and I actually think the Club Sandwich on sourdough with Muenster and avocado is my favorite thing. Yum!

7uLzpVN3cWXFadG8bLqCEw.text: I love this place! Prepare to eat as the food will definitely fill you up. Coffee cake reminds me of my east coast childhood. I say hash browns over potatoes but both are definitely worth trying.

H7faXjbB2y-WLFy8EObnaw.text: Cracked Egg is one of my go to breakfast spots in Henderson. Big portion sizes, large variety of different breakfast and lunch foods, and good service. Almost always a wait on the weekends (15-20 minutes). Some of my favorites on the menu: South Shore Scramble, Oatmeal Overload, Homemade Corned Beef Hash, Peanut Butter Stuffed French Toast, Tuna Melt, Patty Melt.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Egg whites and potatoes

zDkS3UGZalTRJMIPuht0HQ.text: The food here is above average and never greasy, which is very important to me - exceptionally True for breakfast food! I usually order the eggs Benedict and their hollandaise sauce is the best I've ever had. I'm a connoisseur and they are willing to customize my order to meet my dietary needs. I really appreciate that, all of the servers here give exceptional service. Last week while dining for breakfast I asked the waiter about the coffee, it's soooo good and he said it was from a free trade organic source.  I would like to give Sunrise Cafe five stars and I will when they're the first place in town to offer organic eggs and potatoes for breakfast. Organic is important to me for many reasons and I would be willing to pay a premium to have those options!!! Overall - love this place.

26WeD8Iy0ulnNH9EShfn8w.text: My daughter and I came here for the first time and we were very happy with the service, cost, and the food was great. I had the veggie egg Benedict and she had something else (I forgot) lol. But anyways, I'm definitely coming back even though I waited 35 mins to be seated. It was Sunday 11am so i can't complain. (Did I just complain?) Aahahaha..

0mQJ2D5IZ4Ht35w64dbquw.text: Great food. Busy place. Omelettes are huge and we should have split 1.  Good night place for breakfast.

Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Jacks Scramble

2PFuWh7VEquQHsMpIGRVhA.text: I really liked the omlet that I had here. I couldn't finish the hash browns, even though they were crisp on the outside and perfectly cooked. The coffee cake is very deceiving, very lite like an angels food cake consistncy but it filled me up quickly. I still can't decide whether I liked the coffee cake or not. It was a little too lite and very crumbly to the point I was wondering if it was undercooked but it had a nice taste although a tad sweet.  Service was eggcelent. Next time I'm in town, I'll definitely come back.

tWrKXTy0jyTb-PT073WTEg.text: Happy and friendly staff work here nice clean restaurant I had breakfast and I will be returning again and bringing family members I can't believe how busy it is on a Thursday

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. I just found my new breakfast place to come to right here in Henderson

1Z9hDxX95ZLUghFVzasXkw.text: Love this restaurant! Portions are huge! GLUTEN FREE HEAVEN! They have a great gf menu and I have been a couple times and never gotten sick! (Still be careful of course!) Everything is delicious they're gf muffins are to die for!

Y0OxF1LgnTlcDG-Y-78YtQ.text: Service fantastic, food is amazing- my fave is "joes scramble" and so close to my house!!! So happy cracked egg exists!!!!

sJ98Lnbp8sTFoMQfS_cbyw.text: We came here in time, we got seated after 5 minutes. I say this because after a while, there was line and people were waiting even outside to get seated so I'm relieved that we didn't have to wait.   This is my first time here-- it's family oriented that's good for groups too. Our waiter got our drinks right away. I got cranberry mixed with orange juice and south shore scramble. It was a good mix of heart healthy and indulging. South shore was scrambled with eggs, cheese, bacon, and avocado on top with a side of seasoned potatoes. It was good and the portion was just right. I also got coffee as a side. I was so full from the scramble that I barely touched it. I still liked the texture and it's sweetness. It wasn't overwhelming.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. South shore
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned beef hash

9rWFFT_qbsUxddOs4cz_eA.text: My girlfriend and I have eaten here several times, and for some reason the service is almost always spotty. Food is great but the servers seem to be always be in a panic. Today we had a server named Vaneza and she was so sweet from start to finish. She deserves to be recognized! Thank you for the wonderful service vaneza!

2YHcnr4HhGVRhpDmPkEKBQ.text: Good food. For once plenty of butter for pancakes. Scrambled eggs could have been cooked just a hair longer.  Service was ok, not horrible lik the chain restaurants, which was refreshing. Place was very busy for a late Wednesday morning so it was very loud.  The only real negative was the prices, which skew high.

mfAB6mNBnO6EQJItwfh_QA.text: We came here for lunch on a weekday and there was a line, so we thought this must be a nice restaurant. The waiters/ waitresses were friendly and polite. The food was pretty decent. I ordered the Homemade Corned Beef Hash which came with bell peppers, onions and 2 eggs, hash browns, and a toast. My friend ordered South Shore Scramble which came with 3 eggs scrambled with diced chicken, bacon, sliced avocado and swiss, a piece of coffee cake, and fruits. We ended up switching our main dishes ourselves because we like each other's better. I love the scrambled egg and the avocado the most. What is interesting is that the famous coffee cake in this restaurant isn't really a coffee cake as it doesn't have coffee flavor. So we asked the waiter to see if he accidentally served us a chocolate pound cake and he replied, "it's only called a coffee cake," which cracked me up. Overall, I like the combination of their food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Coffee Cake&#34; - Chocolate Pound Cake
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. “Homemade Corned Beef Hash&#34; - Bell Peppers, Onions and Two Eggs, Hash Browns and Toast

NTSDD5Tmi8ednzOIwjWNbQ.text: Our breakfast was great!  We tried a little bit of everything. I was hoping the Monte Cristo would have been more filling compared to other restaurants but the flavor was perfect!   The wait was longer than estimated, but they finally squeezed us into a booth. Service was not the greatest but it was a busy Sunday..

Y9bC7PGr0iDg9mlRA2mPlQ.text: Walked up and huge line of people, didn't realize they were all waiting to pay their checks. Seated after not even waiting 5 minutes, ordered just a regular breakfast of sunny side eggs/bacon/fries/toast. My friend got a chicken/jalapeno skillet. Waiter was attentive, refilled our teas. Food was decent. My only complaint was the bathroom, there's a sign it's under construction but stinks sooooo bad. Almost smells like a funky sewage smell. I walked in -got a whiff & walked right out, such a gross & nauseating smell. I know they're in the process of renovating but made my stomach churn.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggs potatoes and bacon
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken jalapeño skillet, no eggs

RLIt2Wt2FobUsgvPYscbmQ.text: Breakfast too start the day not really in my vocabulary. BUT breakfast after any brick day or workout day nothing better for recovery meal. At The Cracked Egg not only do they offer great breakfast options can order lunch at the same time. I have been too another one of their property on my side of town. Always had great experience from the food, service, and one of my favorite go too breakfast restaurants.   I ordered "The Enchilada" omelette. Instead of toast ALWAYS go for the coffee cake. The coffee cake no matter which one they offer (on this day think was cherry) not only is it fresh, steamy hot, moist, and nice BiG size piece. Awesome that you can substitute your toast for coffee cake! The seasoned potatoes so addicting really could go carb crazy have whole plate of it. I love the seasoning not sure what it is except perfect blend, just want too keep eating them, and perfect compliment with anything eggs or in my case omelette. The Enchilada lot of stuff going on inside the omelette. The enchilada sauce felt like that made all the ingredients come together in perfect harmony. Top off the omelette with the cheese. One of the better omelette ever had for breakfast. The portion size does not end with the coffee cake. Between the omelette and the generous amount of seasoned potato hearty and leave stuffed.   The restaurant is much bigger in size then the one that closer on my side of town. It had more open air feeling too it cause of the size. The interior has the same vibe as the other location. Truly most important is the food is consistent with other location. Great breakfast/lunch spot!!!!! Our server was awesome the whole time staying on top of everything from our drinks and making sure everything going well.   Not often in Henderson but no doubt if in the area need too get my breakfast fix in The Cracked Egg is the spot. I looked forward too the next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. The Enchilada with seasoned potatoes
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Coffee Cake

PWijBSaugGSu0TUMTHHUlg.text: No wonder why this place is empty......The greeter didn't say good morning or even look at me service totally sucked balls.....table was dirty we just left that was enough there not getting my business!!!!!

OLAABp83t96ki9Ws69_CnA.text: Decent food, friendly service. If you're in the mood for breakfast this place hits the spot!

s7cG_6H_wrVelATS1QnAsg.text: EDIT: I had a lot of gripes at first, but I've been back since with a pleasant experience. The parking was only bad the first time and the food was better quality. My wife loves the Benedict.  The first thing I noticed was the terrible parking lot. There are way too many businesses in the shopping center for the size of the parking lot.  Parking aside, I heard great things about this place, so I was looking forward to breakfast. Also, the place was packed, so I assumed the food would be good. It was. The portions were big, and the service was good.  Their breakfast was a little better than IHOP, but priced twice as much. A breakfast for two was $28. A couple of basic omelets, potatoes and drinks for $28? How in the world does this place justify these ridiculous prices?   Advice to management: You blew it on the location with the parking lot, but there's nothing you can do about it now. Cut the price and cut the portions. No one wants to take an omelet home for leftovers.  Fix the value, and I'll give it 4*, because the food was as expected and the staff was pleasant.

oVmw_DbSIpOD78q-orP4tw.text: I never thought I would love peanut butter French toast..... But I do ;).

mw-3XepJoT1dnHs-Z8ewcQ.text: Really awesome place to have breakfast. Try the Taylor Breakfast with polish sausage & Make your own skillet with polish sausage delicious :).Staff are very friendly.

z4FZTnnoni71Cme7yjiz1w.text: Good food.   Fair price.  Very friendly staff Quick service

ngW0_nmCtLjEUiGxZ8i0lA.text: We love to take our daughter here for breakfast or an early lunch.  They have good pancakes, waffles, club sandwiches, turkey melts, pastrami sandwiches, and just about everything else!  There might be a little bit of a wait, but it's always worth it :)

uQraFZtyjl2ZDC7jiMlZ0g.text: I love the corn beef hash and its very FILLING  me and my friends left very satisfied

I1NZaeeredkmJR5R9Qh3oQ.text: This is a great breakfast spot! The entire staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. You may wait, but that's because this is such a great place. The food is delicious and the waiters always have something to recommend or are always able to change the order per a request. The price is fine, unless you're cheap. So if you're cheap, go eat at some casino with mediocre food.

6J1f2O8HTc6_u22Xztg8eA.text: Ordering whites-only omelet and fruit instead of potatoes should hint you that I eat healthy. There is no need to soak my Denver omelet in oil and cover it with cheese (not listed on the description).  Sorry that I didn't mention that I don't get my toast with lard (or was it butter?). Yes, I promise to let you know beforehand and not inconvenience you.  An omelet and a kindergarten-sized cup of OJ for $15? Really?

L8Y1FvTM0OZ-FeHjL4ankA.text: I love that they have a gluten free menu.  The gf pancake is a nice rare splurge.  Beware! It's totally addictive.   Best part? Real whipped butter.

aIOwn_R8tRc7PIOmY_CrBQ.text: First time stopping in .. Love breakfast joints like this but sad to say that on my first experience here was not a joyous one, do to the lack of enthusiasm from customer service and the food at best ! Was mediocre .. I was stoked to try this place because of the reviews it has received and the pics of the food looked delish  .. Maybe just an off day ..

G_uof6mLWm46CUR3Q4tnKA.text: I have had breakfast here several times now.  I usually stick with the scrambles or omelets and have yet to be disappointed.  The eggs are always cooked perfectly and the ingredients are fresh.  I especially enjoy there seasoned potatoes.    Good breakfast atmosphere with a nice location close to the freeway.  Service was fast and they actually refilled my water glass throughout the meal!    The go-to place on the weekend for breakfast in Henderson.

kWWF55a4PBldKqILkdkuHg.text: By far this is my favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas! They have the best food... I recommend the Joe's Scramble.  And you have to get their coffee cake!  The cake is different every time, but always very delicious!    They get very busy during lunch hours and especially breakfast times during the weekend, so plan accordingly.  They have wonderful service and some of the staff even remembers me and I'm not even a regular.  You feel at home here and I'm always stuffed after going.    Enjoy!! :)

zNhGjuVMHWxxYZMivL_Yow.text: The Monte Cristo sandwich is so good, words cannot descirbe it. Enough said.... Get it and you will not regret it.

xbAUT5CgjmHH2BXOwX4tLw.text: Every once in a while I have this crazy craving for EGGS. This visit, I was on the hunt for an egg scramble.   I have been here before but never really pleased my palate. This time, I would like to say that I was very happy and full (for the entire day) with my meal.   I got a scramble... Lucie's Scramble! Made with 3 eggs (yikes!) sausage, onions, bell peppers, mushrooms.... with 2 slices of giant muenster cheese melted on top! Not a single ingredient was lacking, and the portions are nothing short of plentiful. Yum   I wanted to change up my order and avoid the coffee cake and seasoned potatoes (which are good, but distract me from my main meal). Went with the hash browns and toast, and I think I will followup on my decision next time. Yes... there will be a next time, regardless of the spotty service.   As noted in previous reviews... service is a little on the off side, but not BAD. The food is totally worth it. Can't wait for my next breakfast outing.

KKujGDALBv0Y9JC88zbzGw.text: Great service, food is fabulous, location is convenient, restaurant is comfy.  Would recommend this place for anyone.

-WKXnlVvHx_HNyq7VhqtjA.text: I love the food here because it is always made to  order perfectly and is delicious. Unfortunately, no matter what time of the morning or early afternoon, weekday or weekend, I have eaten here, the food takes forever to arrive.  It is always packed! Do not go here if you are in a hurry.  If service and delivery time were faster, I would give it 5 stars.  With all the business they have, and on weekends the long wait time for a table, you would think that they are raking in the money and could afford more waitresses and more cooks. But I will still keep on coming because I do enjoy their food

zrKmGw4sCYF7AjV0j_uxQQ.text: Brunch used to be one of my fav. meals EVER. But, since moving here, we've noticed that LV is not as much of a brunch town as some of its Northeastern, Midatlantic and Midwestern neighbors (We miss you Chi... SNIFF). So, when one of my girls suggested the Cracked Egg for brunch recently, I couldn't say "I'm in" fast enough.   I knew that there were others, like me, who missed brunch when I saw a line the size of India outside this resto. But, when I had my first bite of the GVR (the avocado, muenster, egg white combo is stellar!), I realized that people line up not JUST because they miss brunch BUT ALSO because the food here is delish!   Whatever your reason for coming to the Cracked Egg, you will be in for a treat. Service is great. The food is tasty. And, for a reasonable price (it came to about $100 incl. a 20% tip for 8 of us), you will have a great brunch.   A word to the wise: these folks will accommodate your meal to suit your request so don't be shy to ask. Also, if you order toast and don't want it to arrive pre-buttered, make sure to preference "Dry" toast. The same is True for "Light" cheese, egg whites (in place of eggs), and subbing the potatoes (the seasoned potatoes are awesome!) for fruit or cottage cheese.

YoINoq4ZzyVcpWMPpQElwA.text: Really enjoyed our breakfast here.  A little pricey but worth it.  Service was superb and the food was delicious.  Pancakes were a little heavy, I'd go with a short stack.

UxBCeUkkF3Usjxl0X_pQ-Q.text: Chicken fried steak was so-so. French toast and the egg scrambles were good. Coffee cake was amazing. Warm and fluffy.

CzsC0d1AgpbVLhlt9ilaXA.text: Very good breakfast. There honesty potatoes were golden and perfectly seasoned. Chicken fried steak was very tasteful also. I will be going back

5ZM3iZ2e1gmTOqt0CTaCew.text: Breakfast is my least favorite meal by far and I'll only go out for a weekend breakfast meal about 5 times a year. But when I do go, The Cracked Egg is one of the places I'll go to. Whenever I try to go on a Sunday the lines are out of the door so I recommend Saturdays. The restaurant has two separate dining rooms so there's plenty of seating, especially if you don't have many people in your party.  Their menu has a ton of variety. With most of the breakfasts you'll have a choice of toast or coffee cake and potatoes or hash browns. These are essentials for any solid breakfast spot. On this last trip my boyfriend and I shared the macadamia coconut pancakes and the green scramble. The pancakes are so good they've inspired me to try to recreate them at home. There's plenty of coconut shreds in each bite with the occasional crunch of macadamia nut. The dish comes with three huge pancakes and we were each only able to finish one. The green scramble was also delicious, filled with broccoli, chiles, spinach and chicken. The star of this show was for sure the green salsa. I could drink this salsa it was so fresh and yummy. I would order any dish on the menu that has this (they seem to offer a lot of Mexican inspired breakfasts).   The Cracked Egg is the perfect every-so-often stuff your face full of breakfast food and lay on the couch of the rest of the day. I can't do it very often but when I'm ready for it again and craving those coconut macadamia pancakes I will pretty much always choose to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Coconut macadamia pancakes

UHP6wHskiIkOH6uQ8-2eLQ.text: Used to be really good. Now, not so much. Only writing about my most recent visit and why I won't be going back.  Coffee was $2.65 - and was pretty bad. In part, I didn't discover until my second cup. The "creamers" on the table are actually "non-dairy" in disguise!  So, if you want real milk or cream -you have to ask for it (which they don't tell you!!)  What upset me the most was my waffle. It was a good waffle and their syrup decent - however, for $7 for just a small round waffle (no, no extras just the waffle).  You would think the large cup of what looked like whipped butter would be perfect.  Unfortunately, you'd be wrong. It was a large cup of whipped ... fake something. I'm thinking canola oil but not sure - I am 100% sure it was not in any way butter!  When I nicely mentioned it at check out after spending $25 on breakfast - I got two smirks with a promise they'd pass it on.  So, I'm not the only one that's commented on it. New management needed before you go bust.  So many other places to go for breakfast for a fraction of the price.

QZW4wVhPGk5ubMR6pU2epw.text: Came in here on a Friday morning with an old friend, got seated promptly - wow did this place fill up fast. Got the corned beef hash and some orange juice - everything turned out great. Even though the restaurant was almost at capacity, the food still came out promptly.  If I had to pick one disappointing thing about my visit, it would have been that my friend's coffee got refilled 4 times while we were there without him asking whereas I was never offered a refill or even a glass of water after I finished my shot glass sized orange juice.  Also - I wish they would handle your bill at your table, but I guess they'd rather us just bring it up. I thought this was a little annoying. A good experience nonetheless. I'll get a coffee next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned beef hash, eggs over easy

acys803Y4CaKFHnTd3ifzA.text: Update.... Service continues to drop off. It's a shame because generally food is good. Too much standing around. Too much chit chatting while tables need clearing and surprise, customers need attention. We had four different people attend to us, sat for 8 minutes after getting coffee, menus down and waiting for our server. Who then came back only once after we had to ask someone else's server for coffee. The owner looks around alot, never walks around for insight and seems clueless. Fix the service and we'll be back, otherwise we'll spend our money elsewhere.

0uw-PwlMfqmCAyqnD1bfbQ.text: I wish this were a polite review as I do not like writing bad ones but WOW let me tell you my experience for what happened on Fathers Day! In our tradition that we have started placing orders yes I said orders every Sunday for the cracked egg! We always tip and never have received bad service with to go orders! Well this past Sunday was absolutely horrific, my polite husband orders our food like usually and ask the we believe it was the manager what coffee cake they have for today.., as you know on there website it says they have different coffee cake for the day! She replies and I say on quote " I don't know I'm in the office" then continues to say " I don't want to commit to telling you something I'm unsure of" oh wow really so let me get this straight you can't walk -X- amount of feet to find out what flavor of coffee cake you have???! For the Day!!!!! Actually isn't it your job to know!! I  have officially became that person that I heard the attitude she spewed from her mouth! Really I understand your busy and frustrated but you can't treat people with respect?? I had called back to cancel our order I specifically tell this so called manager that I can order else where, she says so you want to cancel the order I said yes!! My husband doesn't need this especially on Father's Day, I will continue my service to a place that appreciates guest, doesn't decline and give attitude for strictly asking questions in regards to there menu!!!!!!!

bdJHbpK06PKjPxGI4ZDp4g.text: Our first time there and we live 5 minutes away. Very good breakfast and lunch hangout. Numerous options from a very eclectic menu, especially breakfast. Food and service were good. No bar. Seated right away. Plenty of parking. In the same johnera as Rise & Shine. Ciao

BfWZGBZXd5uC6Yw71avCyg.text: We come here often, mostly for breakfast. All their employees are always pleasant and friendly. As you can imagine, they have a vast selection of menu options that include egg options. There are other menu options as well for those who don't like eggs, but honestly, why would you come to a restaurant called cracked egg if you didn't like eggs. Their food is reasonably priced and the portions are always more than you can eat, be prepared to take home a to-go container. There is usually a wait in the mornings, however there is counter seating for the single or couple diners. They also offer to-go orders if you call in, if you don't care to dine in.

obBKkYV1vkB8TwCf6Vm7wA.text: I wasn't ready for the goodness of The Cracked Egg. To be fair, my friend did forewarned me that I would love it. She knows me well! I was hooked. All three times that I visited the Cracked Egg there was no wait time, one of those days was on a weekend.   The space is clean and spacious.  Super friendly and accomodating staff.   What I had and recommend...  - The eggs benedict - French toast - Bacon, egg, and cheese on a croissant. - Coffee  Warning: No wifi; which means people have to talk to each other. I loved that. Get off the phones and eat up people.  I can't wait to go back to Las Vegas just to go to The Cracked Egg.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Bacon, egg, and cheese on a croissant.

-2RVC8aAgy4dWAugxIukiA.text: This is my second time coming here and it was not too busy/packed as it was the first time. The first time I got the croissant French toast with a side of fries (the seasoning on the fries are PERFECT!) and this time I decided to try their Denver omelette without the onions. I chose to get it with a side of seasoned potatoes (which were just like the fries so I was SO happy) and a side of coffee cake.   I love that you can choose between a side of toast or coffee cake - most places you are charged extra if you want another side and most times I don't even want toast so I'm glad that this was an option. The coffee cake was perfectly warm, soft, and fluffy. I love it.   Whenever I get the chance I will come back here and try the other items on their menu. Service is great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Warm and fluffy coffee cake!!!!!!
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Denver omelette with ham, bell peppers, and cheese (took out the onions) and seasoned potatoes

zkIrPL8b6e37D7_wjM24pw.text: I went here for the first time on Saturday, and wow. I actually asked the manager if someone's mom was back there cooking. The food was delicious. They even make their scrambled eggs with cream cheese just like I do. I think I'm in love!   There was a 15 minute wait when I went on Saturday, so today I opted for the takeout. Since everyone was ordering the chicken fried steak, I figured I'd give that a go. It was so good! Crispy and smothered in naughty, rich gravy. It also came with scrambled eggs and hashbrowns plus a delicious piece of coffee cake that I shared with a co-worker.   Up until now I thought Farmer Boys was the big thing for breakfast. They now have some stiff competition!

Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

b-u0nR9MG45sEoOVYyGjvw.text: We have lived here 5 years before finally trying this place, and do not understand what the fuss is all about.  Fairly disinterested wait staff, not friendly at all.  French toast was thin and soggy.  Potatoes were bland and boring with too much Lawry's seasoning.  My eggs were runny. Daughter's scrambled were ok.  Am 100% sure they microwaved the coffee cake before bringing it out. Every item was horribly overpriced.  Not giving lowest rating because coffee was good and Portuguese sausage were good.  We will not eat here again.

qimPFDVPiwRxA8HVBUTrEA.text: Love this place!   Really good breakfast food at a good price. Very clean. The staff is always friendly and attentive.   Hint: If you sign up for their mailing list, they will send you $8 off your bill coupons!

jsfTevsHbeRjSyUyPr4SBA.text: The Cracked Egg is one of my favorite breakfast spots in Henderson.  This place gets busy! But the service here is always spot on.   COME HUNGRY!  There is no such thing as a "light breakfast" here.  Most entrees come with a side (seasoned potatoes or hash browns) and either coffee cake or toast.  The seasoned potatoes are delicious, nice and crispy with just the right amount of seasoning!  And always get the coffee cake!  They bring out the cake first and it's just the right amount of sweet to get you salivating for your meal.  It also pairs great with coffee.   Since I'm not huge on breakfast or heavy meals, I always get one of their vegetarian dishes.  Like I said, their portions are huge!  But with the vegetarian options, I'm able to finish up the plate with a few potatoes left over.   Veggie Benny - sliced avocado, fresh spinach, grilled tomatoes and two poached eggs, and hollandaise sauce.   The GVP scramble - comes with mushrooms, spinach, avocado & muenster cheese topped with sour cream.    I also love the feel of the restaurant. definitely has the old school vibe.  Also look around and read the signs! There's one that says something about putting down your phones & talk to each other like its 19?? (some year before cell phones).

1e_a4Z6OIGLYMwJBPAFWBg.text: I was highly disappointed with the food. The service was great and the waiter was attentive but the food was dry. From the eggs on my sandwich to the potatoes on the side. I see what they tried to do on my mother's omelette (smother it in cheese) it didn't work. And my grandpa even said the coffee cake was dry and didn't taste like before.

Lw24g3RITory8le0gP9hQg.text: How in the world does this place stay in business? Lousy tasteless coffee.  Cream cheese but no discernible meat in Joes special.  Potatoes hard and old.  Truly awful.

PLu-1eSNn7KjNZ4AfUXbiw.text: This place is a family favorite of ours, especially on Sunday! I could only get the kids to go to church with us when they were older if we promised breakfast at Cracked Egg afterward! So we got a little Jesus in them and great food! Lol! Servers are all warm, attentive people. The employees hustle working their tails off to please you! I love the monthly $8.00 off breakfast coupons they mail out. My husband and I share an omelette, have the kitchen split it fit us for a small charge but we always wind up tummies full and happy. I always get a "to go" cup for my morning iced tea before we leave. Love, love, love this place! Our kids are grown up and out, but always find time to have breakfast/lunch there with us!

gxhayghfacaAFQ7OxQ81oA.text: We ordered our breakfast here for our bachelorette brunch, we just picked up our food and took it home. Ashley made it completely easy to order, we had ordered a tray of bacon, eggs,'potato, coffee cake, and it was priced at $9.95 per person. We had so many leftovers!!! Our food was ready on time, making the whole experience so smooth and easy. Definitely will recommend this as a catering option!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. All the food.. I would also like to note they placed this whole ketchup and hot sauce bottle in our bag, so nice

u6W_oqNR_4iUgBrzGFHTDg.text: The food at this place was great! I took my family from out of town here for breakfast and they loved it. Really great food and not overly expensive. The bus boy was also incredibly nice and so attentive.  The only reason this place isn't getting 5 stars is because our server seemed bothered  every time we asked for something. When we asked for more ketchup she snatched it from us without saying anything and then came back and slammed it on the table. She was also clearly annoyed when we asked her to split the check 2 ways.  Great food, but the server could have been friendlier.

SROZsTGKCZLXujQ3f5S_mw.text: Came here right after a flight from Reno bright and early. Overall it was good.  My colleagues ordered their scramble with house potatoes and a spinach omelette, I went with a classic Denver omelette. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered but weren't blown away by any means.   The service was excellent as the waitress was very nice and the food came out super quick.   The price is kinda of high for what I would prefer, coming out to $15-16 not including tip, but if you're looking for a solid sit down breakfast place this a good spot.

YlNXnRLpBhFAtRh2i9CPkg.text: I got the country benny and coffee cake. The benny was ok, the eggs were still wet from poaching which made the mushy. The country gravy was bland and nothing special. The coffee cake was served hot but other than that it tasted like plain white cake with strudel on top. The waitress was very pleasant and service was quick.

LzU47jZzXGBRlnOUoGCpxw.text: This is always our first pick for breakfast! Upsides? Coffee cake, efficient servers, and delicious eggs Benedict! Downsides? Always a wait esp. on Sunday. Maybe they need to expand, make better use of space, or let you reserve online. We live close so we could wait at home :-)

F4kyI_aagFbYKsuerWQ72A.text: I'm starting to branch out and embrace the "art" of eating breakfast...lol.  Like many Americans, I find myself skipping the most important meal of the day, however, once in a while, breakfast is valid.  Today was one of those days.  My boss and I decided to have our meeting at The Cracked Egg, for a change of scenery.  AMBIANCE: The place is alright.  The decor is a little drab and boring.  There are booths and table tops, as well as a bar top to choose from.  I think it's kind of a lame attempt at a diner/breakfast nook-ish ambiance.  Hard to pin point, because nothing really comes together for me.  I do know, however, that it's very busy.  A lot of people seem to enjoy this place.  I'm guessing it's because of the food. LOL.  FOOD and SERVICE:  Today, I got the Eggs Benedict for $9.95.  The bread was kinda of soggy.  Although this entree is smothered with hollandaise, I've had a lot of benedicts to know the potential of the bottom bread.  The poached egg was cooked perfectly, the canadian bacon was thicker than what I'm used to, which is good.  The hollandaise was thicker than what I prefer.  My entree came with hash browns which was crispy on the outside and soft in the inside.  The way it should be!  YUM!  All in all, my breakfast was a hit.  Here's where The Cracked Egg falls short for me.  Whenever I come into this restaurant, I always end up driving separately and meeting my party there.  If I'm the first person there, I'll get a table.  Although my entire party has not arrived yet, the server DOES NOT greet our table until all members of the party arrive.  This was the third occurence that I've noticed.  I think as courtesy, they should at least greet any member of the party, no matter what percentage is present.  I will say that they have employees taking beverage orders in the beginning which I appreciate.  Two instances though, including today, I needed to order right away so I could leave early and make a meeting at work.  That's where I see the benefit of the actual server coming by to greet whoever is there.  Please don't let my rant determine your decision to visit this place.  The food is actually good.  I appreciate the fact that they have healthy options like Garden Patch omelette, the lowfat scrambble, Lighten Up scrambble and an option to have fruit as your side instead of starch options.
