Their menu is filled with lots of a great choices.  Please go in and try their coffee cakes.  They are to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

-dhhwHbtDpC_qHvKtB5UWw.text: Me and my family of six have been going to this place every weekend since we live next door.  Lately however, the food has been getting worse and worse and the last two times they got our order wrong.  Today we got a really rude waitress she brought the wrong order to my son again, never apologized, never came back for refills and when we complained about the bad service,  and asked if we can use a two for one coupon on a check for six people ($80) they told us NO.  Needless to say, we are never coming back again.   Yelp customers would be wise to stay away too! Way to treat your regular customers poorly Cracked Egg.  Shame on you!

-qL-wX-UuMaHDBA2X5G4kw.text: This place would have gotten 4 stars if it weren't for my omelet being made wrong . When it was made correctly it was amazing. The coffee cake was so delicious I don't understand how some reviews say it's bad . The service isn't the best but it's not horrible. I just wish my omelet would have been correct so I could have eaten with my fiance but u had to eat alone since I had to wait for a new one to be made.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

qsPeT5hPrYD7vRXKIdGEBw.text: So I give The Cracked Egg this rating on behalf of my husband. The reason being...     When my husband and I go to Las Vegas, we try to find food eating "gems" that are NOT on the strip. Last time we were there, my husband had wanted a Monte Cristo, and I read that they served one at the Luxor's Pyramid Cafe. We went and he found out it was actually a "Monte Carlo", not a "Monte Cristo".... (sadness on the part of my husband)...     This time, I did some research and found that there was a small chain called The Cracked Egg. We went to the one in Henderson and.... Bruce was in HEAVEN...  It was a REAL Monte Cristo The turkey, ham and swiss cheese dipped in a french toast batter and deep fried, (unlike the Monte Carlo, which is just grilled). I ordered the raspberry stuffed french toast, and was very satisfied. Very tasty and real fresh raspberries all over it too.     Not only were the portions huge... (we couldn't finish either order), but it was all perfectly cooked to our liking. I noticed other orders around us, and they also seemed like very generous helpings. The waiter, was very fast, efficient, but still very cordial.  I liked the fact that is is not just a breakfast house, which includes a "gluten free" menu,  but they have an extensive menu of sandwiches, burgers and salads.      Needless to say, when we visit Las Vegas again, we will definitely go to the Cracked Egg for our breakfast. Maybe try the other ones a bit closer to the middle of town.

q59rlgDVyL-A0vWyMECEDA.text: You like eggs? Do you crave everything egg?  Then why haven't you been to the cracked egg!?  The staff is friendly and helpful, the food is delicious, and the wait to be seating is like waiting for Christmas morning.   We had the coffee cake (which was a seasonal pumpkin cake), huevos rancheros, and the build your own skillet. I slurped up the huevos rancheros like it was the first meal I had in weeks. My wife enjoyed her skillet with the demeanor of royalty.  I'm sure it was quite a site for those around us.   Any way, great place with great food and great people.  Can't go wrong.

s7pr8bUX5qSDo1FOmQs2bA.text: Perfect place to come for an awesome breakfast!! It's off the strip and had a warm feel. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Get the Coffee Cake!! It is a must have...You're welcome! I would definitely come back when I return to Vegas. Enjoy

SX30tXOFM5fSnMZBEAq2oQ.text: I have eaten at Egg & I, Cracked Egg here, Cracked Egg there and all those places in between.  All have been a pleasant experience with exception to the last time a came to this location.  Upon entering the restaurant on a Sunday (My bad, but we were hungry) we were met not greeted by a frownie faced hostessed that addressed us like a herd of cattle.  No put on edge, I awaited to see what was going to happen next.  after a relatively short wait, we were taken to a table where all the scraps from the previous diners and been swept on to the bench I was about to sit on.  I waited to have it cleaned before I sat down.  We sat down to await our server and after several minutes I pulled out my phone and activated the stopwatch feature to see just how long this was going take.  Four minutes before someone other than our server got the drink orders.  When the drinks arrived they were followed by a shower of straws thrown down by the angry lady.  My Yelp senses start kicking in and I remained calm and went into surveillance mode.  The first thing I noticed was that not many employees seemed to be smiling.  The Sunday rush must really have taken it to them.  When we finally ordered from our waiter he was somewhat relaxed but had an edge to him that made me twitchy on a Sunday morning.  I ordered up Greek Scramble  and found to be much as it is at the other establishments....pretty good.  The negative energy in the air and curt demeanor in addition to my cup running empty with a refill not to be found caused my stomach to sour.  This is my last run on this restaurant even though Gary Oldman has supposedly dined there.  I have several crates of Costco eggs that I can make magic with at home.  I will prepare them many ways but with only one smile.

luw3D3D3l02VrMOU57-QzA.text: I cannot lie I come here for the coffee cake. Pretty standard breakfast menu, nothing special. If it weren't for the coffee cake I probably wouldn't come.

Iw9-IGZsHopw1I9ry_hrkw.text: My daughter and I had breakfast here the other day.  It was very hard to understand the waitress.  The bill came to $27.00 for greasy hash browns and omelets that looked like you stepped on them...... they were greasy as well. We sat in a booth that was so small and confiming.....and we are both normal size.  We will not be going back....ever

dVJTdWoCs6uhB8SkqdxG8A.text: I order from the cracked egg all the time. I love the food it's always made perfectly, the one time it wasn't they quickly remade my meal for me which I appreciated. Most of the people who work there are super friendly, the servers, and as well as the manager. The only problem I have, and this is what ruins this restaurant for me, is the girls at the front. I always come in, and leave feeling like I was friendlier than them. They never have a smile or a nice greeting for take out orders. Also I personally work at the front of my work and do a better job greeting and asking people how they are once in awhile other than feeling like I'm at a morgue. Other than that great food rude ladies at the front.

bIX5PYnB4IEKR6HdmKl3bA.text: We eat breakfast here often, the food is great!  The staff is so nice.  It is our go-to breakfast spot.  They are cool about customizing orders and it always comes out perfectly. Guests from out of town have enjoyed it as well, the coffee cake is always a hit for them.

AW2LijMAWxIkyltK10Xz1w.text: I usually go to sunrise cafe on eastern but decided to come here due to the long wait time at sunrise . Turned out to be a horrible decision . Although the staff were all friendly , the food on the other hand was horrible. I ordered the veggie Bennie eggs Benedict with an order of sausage patties (comes in twos). My egg muffin got too soggy , the hash browns were undercooked and there was too much spinach. Proportions were off and the food tasted too salty . I would recommend people to go somewhere else for breakfast. Unless you are dying of hunger , I would recommend one to go anywhere else .

w0UNvL2vdQPvupnHCo00BQ.text: Great breakfast spot. Some of the menu reminds me of small town country cafes from Texas. I love the Country Benny. A great twist on poached eggs and biscuits and gravy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. The country Benny, reminds me of small town Texas cafés.

SE8dhPghuoca-cponGoNNg.text: The long line is worth the wait for this place! Other than a long wait for the food, the food itself is phenomenal! Definitely  give this place a go. Must try for breakfast food fans

GSEwNaR5_VtYGGbRttDXVg.text: My husband and I have been enjoying breakfast at The Cracked Egg for a long time! We had one close to our old place and now we are less than 5 minutes away from this one. This is not my favorite location, but the food is definitely good.   As everyone has already pointed out, the coffee cake is fantastic. It is not exactly what you think of when people say coffee cake, it is more like a white cake with some fruit filling on the bottom and some delicious frosting on top. My only gripe is that I wish they told you what kind of coffee cake they had that day and that there was just a little more fruit filling.  We usually end up getting a skillet, but they also have delicious pancakes! I am in love with the Kicking Potatoes, seasoned potatoes, bits of bacon, and melted cheddar cheese, served with a side of salsa and sour cream. I also like the option to make your own skillet and if you are in the mood for veggies, the vegetarian skillet is a fantastic option. Most of the skillets also come with coffee cake, win!  Now, I am usually very satisfied with the food, but have received spotty service from this location. Nobody seems too happy to be working here, from the hostess, to the waitstaff, to the manager. I have even seen the manager take on a customer who had a food allergy and was very specific about his order, which they messed up. I don't think it is ever OK to argue with a customer, especially in this situation where it could have gotten really severe if the customer had a life or death allergy. There were quite a few people in the restaurant and the loud exchange was certainly avoidable, I think a sincere apology would have gone a long way. I was also present when they messed up a rather large take-out order for some of my fellow team mates at work and didn't do much to rectify the situation.   I also really dislike the fact that you have to take your check up to the cash register. That area can get very congested in the morning since it is also the hostess station. If you manage to fight the crowd and make it to the register, I find it quite uncomfortable that they ask you how much tip you would like to leave. I don't understand why they can't just let you fill out the receipt like every other business. Overall, the food is good, but don't prepare to be WOWed by the service.

DLgVzBY7EJNOKhf_cV68sA.text: Good Portions and delicious fresh coffee cake. The eggs were off the chain! This is a very busy place and their waitress' provide excellent service. If you want a very filling breakfast, you're at the right place.

lylNQ45qqc4u8EsiMAngNg.text: Get the rewards program. Best breakfast in town. Eggs anyway you want. Substitution welcome. Great service.

Wzu-5rngYOuVxo5Jf0tzYA.text: Great breakfast! My parents want to come here every time they visit me. Great prices, good service, classic breakfast items. Can't really go wrong.

QtIGl0Em4F2obsjeiTJUNQ.text: Great food - exceptional service. Just moved to Henderson from L.A. and this will be a destination breakfast spot for me and my friends. The Huevos Rancheros is great and you have to get the coffee cake. YUMMY!!!

yZogsH7Hl10njU0vUE7H4Q.text: Not bad.  A nice change from buffet breakfast at green valley across the freeway.  I'd eat here again

UlEkWsY2N_O_9CaN6yQdrQ.text: Worst service I've ever received. They simply care more about themselves than pleasing the customer.  We came to meet my mom and surprise her, we asked to have one of the several empty tables near my mom's table pulled next to her table and my mom's server refused, "because it wasn't her section." Uh ok, whatever! So my husband and I just sit at a table next to my mom and wait and wait and wait for our server who never comes. I say to my husband, I think we need to let the hostess know since we just sat here. So I did and apologized for not making her aware of us taking the table and could she get our server.  The hostess was more than put out but I ignored it. Our server grudgingly showed up, took our order and disappeared, never to be heard from again until our food showed. I had two eggs over medium, they were fine except my food was served on a  warped plastic plate that kept spinning every time I ate off of it. My husband ordered basic eggs Benedict. The eggs were so under cooked that the whites looked literally like snot. So nasty. He pointed it out to the server and she proceeded to tell him that's how eggs Benedict are served and continued to argue with him even after he told her that was not True. The manager who came over was quite nice and apologetic and removed the EB from our bill with out hassle. It took forever to get our bill from the disgruntled server and when we finally did, it appeared that the EB had not been removed. I asked the previously rude hostess who is now our cashier to look into it and she proceeds to tell me that the reason we had such a bad experience was because we had sat ourselves. Well needless to say at this point, I'm offended beyond reason and I begin to lose it with the hostess. The manager comes again and is very nice again, but he clearly has no control over his staff. I NOR MY HUSBAND WILL EVER FREQUENT THIS ESTABLISHMENT AGAIN! The food is not worth the hassle and it's very over priced. I ended up paying $18 for two eggs, toast, hash browns, bacon,  and coffee. And as someone else that wrote a review stated the entire wait staff starting with the hostess are rude, unfriendly and act like they are doing you a favor. Stay away. I had been going there since the place opened and kept having bad experiences, which culminated into my last and final atrocious experience.

Y1FtoIwTlo_joqQId4CCDw.text: First time ordering the eggs Benedict and I hated it. The eggs were runny and whatever English muffin brand they used was flat.  The holindase sauce had to have been from a powdered mix not made fresh.   To top it all off the waitress Cynthia was horrible.  She was so unattentive, horrible service today.  It will be awhile before I go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Carnitas omelettes with hashbrowns and wheat toast.

gx1XfYsISQ87qSBhlgDV7w.text: We've eaten numerous times here and I can say the food and service is great. But TODAY the service just to be seated SUCKED... We asked for a booth for a party if 5, 2- booths were empty, guests that arrived after us got seated??? First of all don't say we wouldn't have fit in a booth since majority ALL the booths are the same size and 2nd don't LIE to my face and say the party that you just sat came before me!!! It will be awhile until I'm stepping into this restaurant.

ljC00k0xm7KPZYDjm4JzWA.text: If we lived in Henderson, I would be eating breakfast here every weekend!! Just happened upon this gem while searching for a drugstore. My husband LOVES eggs so he immediately said yes when I mentioned going here for breakfast. I had the peanut butter and banana french toast, it was amazing! The portion size of my meal was huge and well worth the price. My husband got the Monte Cristo, he loved it! If you are a local, I highly recommend checking this place out. I just discovered there is more than one location, so when we're in LV or Henderson again we will be eating here again for sure!

fCbXgwagJQoXh66A8omlWA.text: I had a sausage and cheese omelet and to be honest not that great not so bad I couldn't eat it but just not great.

I1ZicnneCYvJZhqviPOn7w.text: This is a review for the Peanut Butter French Toast specifically. I've been to The Cracked Egg a few times before and really enjoyed ththis'd ops and the prices were very reasonable. This time, however, I was long happy with what I ordered at all. I strayed away from my usual eggs, meat, and gravy breakfast and tried the Peanut Butter French Toast. I was not impressed. There was not enough peanut butter, the bread was small and too soggy, and overall this French toast was just a horrible, dissappointing mess. Never again... Never, never again...

VFHxsFtxDOr5nCKXana6_g.text: Very disappointed to find out they're pancake mix is premade! Even with my sons milk and eggs allergy they said it was impossible for them to mix some flour and water for his pancake. I might as well leave my toddler at home... My server had an attitude right away and we only saw her about twice from sit down to leave. The food was no better than a Denny's, I probably won't come back, although the coffee cake was really good. That's the only part we enjoyed

GogtMtIltLV6i4NNsnPw0g.text: Food is ok. Service is horrible. 3x here and waitress and overall service makes me not want to come back.  The fact that they are busy should not affect  ... HOSPITALITY !!!

hohvnY-L223BerUTxaMxZg.text: I enjoyed the fact that even though this restaurant was busy, my friend and I were sat within 5 minutes. Our server seemed friendly enough, but he barely came to our table, and didn't ask me if I wanted a refill on my coffee or orange juice. I ordered the short stack of blueberry pancakes, and when they came out they looked good enough, but were very bland to taste. They also weren't cooked all the way through. There was still some liquid batter in the middle. Maybe it was an off day since this place was packed, and seemed to have a lot of regulars. Maybe I'll try this place again, maybe not. I'm on the fence.

IoCVVOTwISthrV5M91L3yA.text: It has great food but the service is horrible. Go before you're hungry because it takes forever just to get drinks. I've gone twice to different locations and it doesn't change the fact that the service is horrible.

PAHJt7WBKszpUO-EnK5_Ow.text: The place was packed but my friends and I got bar seats as soon as we walked in (no waiting if you sit at the bar).  The coffee cake is amazing, light and not too sweet.  Oh, and warm like it just came out of the oven.  I got the veggie benedict and doused Cholula and ketchup on it.  There are a ton of choices on the menu and it can be overwhelming.  Just means I have to go back to try the other dishes.

ylbAg4zlcE3C1d7wLWPQuw.text: Once again my favorite breakfast spot does not dissapointment service is good food is excellent and cooked perfectly to order. Hands down my fav spot for breakfast in las vegas. The coffee cake is always fresh and a great substitute for the traditional white or wheat toast. I think I have said enough. I'll be back soon

2ws6QXivL5nLKzrlQH5i1g.text: I eat here all the time, great food and atmosphere. Service is usually quite good even when they're busy. Join their rewards program for $8 off coupons in the mail, makes it more affordable!

Cyai96n2IHP0RpEZkUs5bw.text: As others noted, I too noticed a considerable lack of good, creative brunch spots in Vegas.  Most places are the same ol', same ol'.  Eggs, bacon, hashbrowns.  The Cracked Egg doesn't deviate too much from this standard. It mostly offers typical breakfast fare - an assortment of omelets, pancakes, scrambles, etc.  If you're in the mood for something relatively unique they do have plenty of options for interesting omelet combinations, a delicious benedict ole (heart attack on a plate), and their "coffee cakes" - a standard side with many of the menu items - are divine (and flavors vary daily, it's not your typical coffee cake, they must use smooth as silk cake flower and maybe add in sour cream or something to give it creaminess and tang).  My favorite standard is the huevos rancheros.  A simple tasty sauce covers refried beans, eggs how you like them, sitting on a flour tortilla and topped with melted cheese and jalapenos.  It's simple, but they do it well.  Not too much cheese (I really don't need to eat 12 oz of cheese in a given meal like some places believe), medium spicy peppers, and plenty of beans, just how I like it!  It's not the most unique food you can find (although it's as unique as any I've found in this city) nor is it on the top of the healthy list, but it's satisfying and consistent, reasonably priced, and has become my weekend go-to place!

NUotUFMKCJxeOo190yzxKA.text: If you don't want to deal with the buffets on the strip...this is the next best place to have breakfast. At first by the environment you'd think that the food would be sub-par at best...boy I have never been so happy to be wrong. This place is amazing!

IOYI4MT_fHkvcPMNBNT7DA.text: Love coming here and have a big breakfast.  Perfect for a morning breakfast after a night out or just a good way to start off a lazy day.  Service is good but not great, but hey, you should come for the good food not the service

0_bDdV9ElsYt6j4I9tQvrg.text: The Cracked Egg is awesome.  My favorite is the Californian Omelet.  The different coffee cake's are always a nice surprise.   We have always had prompt accurate service.  The wait is usually short even if people are waiting.

X5klvWUmAM8prbK0-OBnNA.text: I have eaten at several different locations including this one, today was quite disappointing. The "seasoned" potatoes had little to no seasoning whatsoever along with being cold, the eggs had a pool of grease laying on them and the toast was not buttered at all. There are a lot of breakfast places in town and I will be taking my business elsewhere.

SJ0Nfoq_GRpFcxVkUNq82Q.text: Good breakfast place, really nothing special, but not horrible either.  Wife's tropical french toast was dry and overly sweet. The place was full of diner's so they do have a following. The coffee is strong and good. Sugar dispenser and more creamers would be nice. We will have to try again sometime, but probaly not likely.

fA2ZO40Uy3lQAGqkvSQgjA.text: Super busy when I walked in but was managed well. Chicken fried steak is my weakness in breakfast resturants and this one was on par.

NDjP_4OBrAjLW27CTuXoYA.text: The food is fresh and delicious.  Nice selection of skillet "scrambles".  Our service was great and our server, Laura, is by far the best.

TJLyKrKgzy4W0hF_DJuLQw.text: This is one of the best breakfast places I've found in Vegas. Staff is friendly and food is great. Line is usually long on weekends, but they seat people quickly. Only down side is hash browns are always soggy, even if you specify you'd like them cooked crispy.

dLpv9KjuyqKNCLhDaYp67g.text: LOVE this place! My husband and I like to eat out for brunch, and had tried multiple different places before we found this one. There is usually a pretty decent wait (apparently we're not the only ones who love it!), but it's worth it. They serve warm coffee cake before the meal, and it's gigantic and tasty. I typically get an omelet with hash browns, and am never disappointed. Great atmosphere, too - you don't feel too crammed in like you do at some places.

uqQJoqZHm6_yViET_TpVVA.text: I'd give it 2.5 stars if possible simply because most of the food is good (not great, not mediocre, just good).  However, the food is overpriced, portions are not huge, and service is usually bad.  Count on spending $12-15 per person for a meal, tax, and tip; add a few more bucks if you're getting a beverage.  Coworkers who suggested this place to me said I could have a full meal for $6; based on menu prices, I assume my coworkers consider toast and coffee a full meal.  The restaurant is very loud and cramped.  Your wooden chairs will get bumped into by anyone trying to pass and the screeching of wood on tiles will give you a headache.  There isn't much of a waiting area and given this place's popularity, you'll probably have to wait.  My chicken chile verde omelet was good, seasoned potatoes very tasty, and our various sandwiches good but nothing special.  The coffee cake was awful.  It was like stale angel cake purchased from a gas station, sprinkled with cinnamon, and stuffed with canned apple pie filling.  Good service usually changes my opinion of a restaurant, but this was downright bad.  Our waiter was curt, only gave us one coffee refill (after flagging him down), and tossed our check on the table before we'd finished eating.  The restaurant was significantly less crowded than when we arrived so I'm not sure why he was in such a hurry to get rid of us.  We're nice people who have worked in restaurants and sympathize with overbusy waitstaff.  I only go here when I'm with pretentious friends who insist on eating at local mom & pop shops instead of IHOP or Denny's.  Eat here if you must and enjoy your smug satisfaction; I'll be over at IHOP feasting on better food for less money.

HLEkDVrHya0-WspkXQ2bKA.text: Nice little place outside if Las Vegas. Got the steak breakfast. Steak was a good size and the eggs and hash browns were a good serving. The atmosphere was very home town cafe like. Not noisy at all. Service was great. Asked for a drink when I sat down and my Pepsi never got empty. The staff was very friendly. I am glad my friend recommeded this place for lunch. Not sure if they have wifi.

jpAl_4XryfryyFU9iBLxeA.text: I am definitely a fan of Cracked egg. Not just because it is very close to my work that is why I always go there for lunch. But cracked egg always keep me full with their amazing eggs omelet. Downsides are it is pretty pricey and that it is always always busy around lunch time, and I will always have to wait for a table for party more than 4 people.

7QHHhaPLLoUbuGnJ12hP8Q.text: I am really more like a 2.5 on this one, and it really does pain me to rate it so low. The food is very good - and worth the money. As some other reviewers have pointed out, the food is priced fairly high, even for simple dishes. However, what really takes this down for me is the service. In the time we have been coming here, only one server - Indra - really qualifies as friendly. Today, our server was downright lousy. He was very inefficient - the restaurant wasn't busy, and he seemed to have no sense of order in terms of how he took care of his tables. Honestly, if the service was just a bit better, I would probably come here more often.

5L6WXPD9JtazH4wilNSWtQ.text: This is one of my most favorite Breakfast places.  I eat at this place all the time and I go to different ones all the time too.  They are very consistent - the service is good, the food is great.  I always get the same plate... Southwestern Scramble with Hashbrowns and English Muffin.  Damn that is good stuff!

mhzv9V3U2Z8Lq4fxIzhxPw.text: Great service and food, we were seated right away didn't have to wait at all. The club sand which was delicious and had large pieces of avocado on it. Would highly recommend this place for a breakfast or lunch meal. Try the banana chocolate chip pancakes, a little sweet but amazing.

RiXWJIzUt9oofmTI3ZagbA.text: One of my favorite breakfast places in Vegas, along with its sister the cracked egg on the west side. the stuffed french toast is one of the best things on the menu, but they have very good food over all.

hNe7vioxq1Q_Jre3cbRlrA.text: I live next to this place and I feel lucky.  It's a great spot for a great, fresh breakfast.  The veggies are always fresh and not pre-frozen like at some other spots and their pancake options are delicious.

RllOuF1CiMfdbtgv755BzA.text: Been to this location many times (and the S. Rainbow as well). Attentive and friendly service. If with a regular customer, the waitstaff pretty much already knows what they want. Food arrives in a timely manner.  Overall, everything I've ordered has been tasty. Large portions. The spicier dishes (eg. anything with chorizo and or green chile) are too mild for my tastes, but like that there is the option to have something with some non-Anglo flair. The coffee cake I had as my "toast" option on this past visit was a bit of a disappointment: taste and consistency of something that came out of a Betty Crocker box.  Nice breakfast place. And if you go on a regular basis, don't forget to sign-up for their loyalty program to get discounts on future meals.

IJWgC_YKzBixvlsRj_xE6Q.text: NOT worth the money or the time. Second time there. The first time, the service wasn't so great, but the food was ok, so me and the hubby gave it a second try.. BAD idea. We will not be back!!! Took almost 15 minutes for someone to ask us if we wanted drinks. Which in my eyes is not good customer service!! I got the Veggie Benny and the avocado was black. GROSS.. My hubby got some egg sandwich, which was a sloppy mess.. GO TO EGG WORKS on Sunset!! Customer service there is an A+ I give Cracked Eggs customer service a C and that's generous!!

xIDLk0HbH7LZojENVwqOoQ.text: I LOVE The Cracked Egg! My husband and I drive 4 hours to get to Las Vegas for two reasons, the pinball hall of fame and the Cracked Egg. They have great service, delicious food that is always fresh and excellent coffee. Well worth the wait (which, if you have a larger party, will be certain)

f5CMcyxm_suqJ0w4Vx0IYw.text: You never know what the coffee cake will be but it's always a winner!  From one hour to the next it might be the apple, cherry, chocolate chip, etc. Always served nice and hot.

94LGEzB2GC6kKKqG6ceZsQ.text: this has always been my go to breakfast spot. one of the only places in vegas with gluten free blueberry pancakes! the service is always friendly and their coffee is super good. great for take out as well.

8q2ZQgOGMtjykphmax7U7Q.text: I ordered the biscuits and gravy and was given some extremely dense hockey pucks with a white hash filled gravy like substance.  The "famous" potatoes were cold and season less.  That's $15 I wish I had back.

oiZR_c8zVedpBffV3N7ChA.text: I would cut them some more slack since it's a holiday but they really weren't that busy when we got there and even less busy when we left... The wait was about five minutes and the server was quick and efficient with our drinks and taking our orders. Once our food arrived; however, he was nowhere to be found. My friend Lisa L had the pancakes and I had the tropical french toast... I know the description said coconut but this thing was COVERED in shredded coconut. Like the whole surface was pretty much shredded coconut. The flavor was great and the texture was nice but I literally filled up on shredded coconut. We spent about 20 minutes sitting around waiting for our server to come back so we could get our bill and though he walked by like four times, he didn't so much as glance in our direction. By this time, the crowd had really thinned out too so it's not like it was crazy busy. The food was good enough to warrant three stars but the service left us frustrated. It would be one thing if the server was so busy he couldn't make it through the room but we saw him pass so many times and it took forever to flag him down.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

qEvpedaC55IG-leBnbiGcw.text: This place is great! So far we have been here twice and we were pleased with the service as well as the food. Make sure to sign up for their loyalty card and you'll score some coupons.

Gzrwhxwn0TSrw8Z86q6Dmw.text: Juevos rancheros and Denver omelette. Juevos rancheros was pretty good. Omelette was just ok. Cheese was on top which is weird. I prefer it in the middle. Veggies were cooked into the egg, which is also weird. It was meh. Seasoned potatoes were ok. Coffee was kept full. Service was good.

8STjWO6DR9HyMHCazTwSXA.text: The hot spot to be in Henderson,  this place is always jamming and no wonder. The coffee and the coffee cake are great wake ups in the morning. Egg whites are available and if you do have to wait it's not too bad. Weekends are busy with family and kids but it's worth it. Ask for Juan and tip him at least 10 to 15 % of your annual income, he 's a nice guy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

MY0rXDL5NYbBjf7Xyl_T9A.text: My favorite breakfast spot of all time! I have ate inside the restaraunt quite a few times but I only live like 2 miles away so I do to go orders a few times a month.   They really have some amazing stuff on the menu. It is worth checking out the menu before you go so you are prepared. I'm a simple guy so i usually get coffee, the cakes & eggs combo which is basically 2 large pancakes, 2 eggs and 2 slices bacon.   I've tried a few varieties of things other people with me have ordered like stuffed french toast of peanut butter, nutella. I've tried the eggs benedict, coffee cakes, biscuits in gravy, chocolate chip pancakes, etc. Really it is all very good!   The place is very busy on the weekends. I got to go orders in like 15 minutues but sometimes if you go on a Sat/Sun morning you could have up to an hour wait to get seated and it is not a small restaurant. Thats a good sign!   I think the only drawback is sometimes when I crave in the evening/night, they are closed. I think the hours are 6am-3pm which works for breakfast/lunch meals.

Ib3Rh2wXtw-lMrDb8eSRKg.text: Honestly this place is a joke pancakes 15 dollars that's crazy the workers can't even speak English so that's weird trying to give a family business money but not when they r ripping you off cute place YES .. but the food is not good enough for the price

eLLfuRBFCEmpOai73TBz8w.text: Food: C+ Decor: D- (Is it a barn? Is it a rundown Denny's?  What??) Service: B- Prices: HIGH!  A 2 for 1 coupon drew me in but I was unimpressed as I sat down on the semi-padded booth seats which must be 100 years old. The menu is extensive with both breakfast and lunch entrees. Something for everyone. Prices seemed to range between $9 and $14. Little pricey for breakfast.   The hash browns seemed soaked in grease and weren't very hot (reheated maybe?). The bacon was extra chewy, leading me to believe it was cooked much earlier in the day and ''stored'' until needed.   It's drab and dark inside of the restaurant, and the employees seemed not to care much. Could have been cleaner in my opinion.   Sorry but I'll take EggWorks ANY day.

KU0GSnmzRPDvNdQ9AKQuOQ.text: First time here and I am hooked! Diana was wonderful and helpful. Asked her for a meal suggestion and she asked me questions regarding my preferences.  Boy was she on point!  It was delicious!   Has the Chili Verde Ranchero...very savory. ..should not have eaten the whole thing but couldn't help myself!

Bete1WaimJaXRQRQ5zb-MQ.text: Food is home made, fresh and fabulous!! Coffee cake to die for!! Come hungry and leave with a to go box. The staff is amazingly friendly constantly, and take the time to learn your name likes and dislikes.

2SS3_PFIL-K382lIMy6sJQ.text: Please RUN, do not WALK to The Cracked Egg for breakfast!  I highly recommend the seasoned hashbrowns.  And, when they give you the choice between toast or coffee cake, for the love of all things delicious, CHOOSE THE COFFEE CAKE!  It is amazing.  One star off for being a little overpriced for breakfast, but this is by far the best breakfast joint around.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet coffee cake! So glad we got there when we did. The flavor changed shortly after

bf-cWHDoe--W91ux9kq_Tg.text: Best breakfast place I've been to here!! I got the southwest omelet and it was YUMMY! Wow who thought of that one? I will be trying this at home.   5 stars on service  5 stars on food 5 stars on cleanliness   I can't say much else!

Y5tjKO9TeYHU1qv3WdyTNQ.text: This is THE BEST place for breakfast. Absolutely try the coffee cake, it is amazing. Fast, friendly staff. The place is packed pretty much always, that's how good it is. Can't wait to go back!

pTxdO-K6va3HAOe6lDXgHw.text: Traditional American breakfast place with decent prices. Definitely go for the side of potatoes instead of hash browns. Coffee cake is light and their coffee is good. Portions are huge. If you're in town, this is a safe bet and can accommodate large parties. With a party of 6 we only had to wait 5 minutes or so on a Saturday morning. Not too shabby.

DJyTQiR0m6VEm_JtTuEd0Q.text: Always have time to stop in here and have a bite. The food  is great, service is awesome. Wait time is minimal especially on a Sunday.   If you ever get a chance to stop in, you won't regret it.

s_5N9eQIN1Q9Ddbx-0xwcg.text: They had my name in a menu selection, how can I not be a fan! :)   This place is really neat. I have never been to a Cracked Egg before in Vegas, and I am happy to have popped that cherry at this location. I would love to go back and try some other things I was eyeing. I just could not make a decision, but I settled for an omlette and it was good!   It felt like a country vineyard type place. It was just very charming. Our service was not bad, just rushed it seemed like. Maybe they need to hire a couple more people in the morning rush of the weekend!   I would like to try more stuff, so I shall be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

X5mcZqfWDcXCqV3C8vvmJg.text: You would think most restaurants these days would make there main business about why you come to restaurants in the first place, food and fellowship.  The wait was horrendously excessive.  After waiting 45 minutes to be seated, it took another 45 minutes to receive our food.  When I finally get my meal, it was all just pre made packaged food.  Look at the photo of my breakfast, those potatoes were pre-seasoned and nothing to brag about.  I will not be coming back for the simple fact, the wait was just so damn long!!!  Wasted two and half hours of my life.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Breakfast eggs and bacon.  Potatoes are not homemade...sigh...

-g04SJvZwibuo_XoIJakQA.text: Went on holiday weekend, just had to wait about 20 minutes, so not bad.  Had the verde Rancheros.  Not sure if I would order it again.  I did like how the eggs were runny under all if the cheese and meat.  Service was excellent.  Seem to have an extensive menu, but did not see chiliquiles on the menu, which is one of my favorites.

6K6s2ypNpb0M9AnHGSFrzg.text: The service was great and the food was delish! I had the croissant egg sandwich with hash browns, coffee and orange juice. I would go here again for sure.

0IxppA_up_xibg92Hh9JOA.text: When I spend money somewhere, I expect a thank you. The food was fine, but the hostess ignored me when I came in and failed to thank me-- just pushed the receipt at me--when I paid. I won't be back.

1FYW9QEjTMApJVqga9di2w.text: This place always has a line so I expected to have an amazing breakfast. Boy was I disappointed. Our server wasn't very warm or friendly. No greeting or menu tour - when she approached the table she said "ok what can I get you". When I told her our group needed another minute she made a face and was clearly annoyed.   I'm not sure what this place is known for. Breakfast burritos? Pancakes? I had the Greek omelette which was awful. The eggs were overlooked. The best part was the toast. Hash brown were greasy and tasted like oil.

Rb4Atb780Zo5sTAORyI_mQ.text: Came in for my some delicious breakfast a bout a week ago and got it! Eggs Benedict and french toast on the side! Definitely my new favorite breakfast place! There is a huge selection of things to order, i wonder what i will try next...

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

kyCWselljz_yhRbkI0ncZQ.text: Did Sunday brunch here and it was amazing. Wife had the tropical French toast and I had the huevos rancheros. Both were amazing. The place was packed, but we were seated in about five minutes. Our waitress was attentive and friendly. My wife is picky about getting "crispy" bacon and they nailed it! We loved it.

ccSXa1d5Q_wAKDbVPTvlbw.text: This place is on point!  Delicious food! Great service! Welcoming ambiance!  What more can I say!?!  We had the classic French toast combo and a bacon cheeseburger skillet. Both were yummy! Price was awesome, especially for the large portions.

F_hV-UN9axlaRCOd5iH0DA.text: The Veggie Benedict was delicious! And I highly recommend the seasoned potatoes.  Staff was great and very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Veggie Benedict

__bERBz6GXup0SLli7M-vw.text: My wife has been here several times but this is my first. She was craving the Monte Cristo. I love a good Eggs Benedict. After other reviews, I got mine with the sliced avocado on the side. That just put it over the top. Very good seasoned potatoes. See my picture to see what I thought of it.  My wife loved her Monte Cristo. I don't think it's anything special. It wasn't greasy at all, which it is at some places. A little on the small size if you ask me. Served with maple syrup instead of the traditional fruit compote or jam.   A great breakfast spot for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with avocado on the side.

jJxEWq6DeRDDRN_ZQbtJyA.text: Fast seating although it was very busy when we checked in. I ended up getting the country benny and it was excellent. I'm picky when it comes to biscuits and gravy and these were some of the best I've had.   Oh, and the breakfast potatoes are AMAZING!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Country Benny!!!

ZDrBHgUPESibs-2-5imeHQ.text: I'm done I apparently have to high of expectations when I go out for food or get delivery.  Is it to much to ask to be a place that follows their menu and ensures that they have the ability to give you a good experience.  If your a sit down restaurant no matter what time you open or close you should have the ability to make change.  Fast food I get it it's a safty thing.  I am over this place being over priced and the staff being rude and unprepared for business!  Go eat here and over pay and have crap for service!   Again if I'm paying I want top notch service I don't work for shitty service I don't give so I will not accept it!

j_NJR650WsmjUi5SjGxP5Q.text: I ordered the "Big, bad wolf" omelet and it was okay. There was too much cheese on the omelet, that's for sure. And the other half of the plate were some mediocre has browns. There was really nothing special about it, which I thought it would be. I really feel like I ordered the wrong omelet and I am willing to give this place a try again.  On the other hand though, my grandparents ordered "the club" sandwich (they both only ate half of the half) so when I got home I tried the sandwich and it was about of this world!!! I mean it was super delicious. 3 pieces of bread, loads of avocado. It was just delicious. I would never have thought a sandwich would be better than an omelet at a place called "the cracked egg"!   I should also note that, this place was busy, and VERY loud, so this is not a great pick if you need to chat with whom ever you are with!

uZQCDmS5mGcTmdclYyGdug.text: My spouse and I decided to try something new this Sunday. We stopped in after 1PM and the place was about 1/2 full. Waited about 15 minutes for a server and finally went to the front desk who took our drink orders. Finally after 20 minutes we "caught" the server who was scurrying by our table. She took our order. We waited, and waited, and waited, and waited. There were four employees, managers at the front desk who just were jabbering away. I never did see them do anything the full time we were there. We finally "caught" the waitress who was zipping by. She said the kitchen was "backed up"! The place was less than 1/2 full. Goodbye! We left and went to McDonald's.

hUxmiuwDu3EH6nGSdru3pA.text: 6 of us went to The Cracked Egg twice during our trip to Vegas.  It's near The Legacy Golf Club so it was a prime location for us to eat breakfast.  Everything we ordered was either excellent or really good.  Here is the list of dishes, if I can recall them all.  Huevos Rancheros Chili Verde Rancheros (This was my order.  It was excellent) Oatmeal (It was the largest bowl of oatmeal I've ever seen.  It came with a bowl of beautiful fresh berries.  My friend loved it) Chicken and gravy as well as biscuits and gravy (It looked great.  He said it tasted great) Bacon and eggs (He said the eggs were cooked perfectly) Carnitas Omelette (This was my dish on day 2 because I wanted to try something different.  The only reason I didn't give a 5 star is because the omelette had way too many onions.  They were tasty, but just too many).  If I'm in the neighborhood the next time I'm in Vegas, I'm definitely going to The Cracked Egg.

7k_1NymkNrRhS1v6Hh2Oqw.text: Incorrect wait time guess , understandable . Food taking forever , understandable . Bringing my kids food and then ours 10 minutes later , not cool . Cashier line with 10+ people waiting to pay , not cool . So we decided to leave our cash and tip on the table so they could deal with it , we had to get out of there , took forever . Come out to my car and accuse my wife and I of not paying in front of my kid ? That's bull ! Y'all need to re-evaluate your business . Lucky I didn't stop back in there and ask for my generous tip back after being treated like that . Will not be coming back , plenty of other places similar with better service !

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

5iM2z1_LDDtnp6U10eZ3kQ.text: We ate at 3 breakfast spots while in Vegas. This is ranked number 3 of 3. Food is pretty basic, price is on the high side for the quality of food. Will not be my go to spot on are next visit.

A9eCEmd36fBGMwn2yJbLOw.text: My boyfriend and I love this place. Their gluten free pancakes are sooo good. This time we got the cinnamon roll gf pancakes and the sourdough Benedict. He said it was the best breakfast he's had in awhile. Their coffee cake is super good too. Our server was really nice as well :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Sourdough Benedict, gluten free cinnamon roll pancakes

pbFl9pnoJg5STPx_aCer_w.text: My favorite breakfast spot in henderson. I've been coming here for at least 10 years. The food and service is always good. Wish they had better coffee and that they dropped the check soon after your meal was served. Most of the time I have to ask for it. Come early on weekends or expect to wait as this restaurant gets very busy.

XTkMhBvy5nHJWUa6QSXWMg.text: Salad was huge. It tasted very good as well. Candied walnuts were harder than I expected & a little hard to chew but over all I would get that salad again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. The Berry Salad

YILHY2cTvI57-vJPdHeOlg.text: The Benny was ok. The stuff peanut butter French toast was ok. The Carnitas Omelet was the best. The hash browns was nasty. The Waffle was nasty. Hot CoCo was good. The bottom line is my family don't want to go back ever.  Ps the Candy at the Register was even nasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. The Benny!
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy! Coffee Cake no to sweet just Wright!
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Coffee Cake and Hot CoCo.

fT9egdoflGGSPH2Zhf2Byw.text: This is my second time coming to The Cracked Egg and it did not disappoint. The breakfast potatoes are the best I have ever had. The omelette could use a bit more seasoning but it was still good. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

3CTMLRoy1npRs7FGhx03wQ.text: Decided to check out their Eggs Benedict this morning. Dreena was our server this morning, and she was great. She was attentive and very professional.   We always split a breakfast and get a side of some kind. So we ordered the Benedict, replacing the Canadian Bacon with regular bacon, and then decided on a coffee cake. We ordered coffee, and I like that there was regular cream as well as vanilla creamer already at the table. The coffee was really good. Nice and hot, and had good flavor.   Our coffee cake came out very quickly, and after about three bites of that our breakfast arrived. The coffee cake was very crumbly, but really flavorful. Nice vanilla flavor with a hint of lemon in the icing. The eggs Benedict was not a huge portion, actually rather small. Definitely not worthy of sharing like we typically do. Good to know, so next time we will actually get separate breakfasts. I like their use of green chiles throughout the menu, so we will be checking those out at some point.   We arrived at 9:30 Sunday, and the place was jamming. It was loud, but not bad. We felt rushed, even though our server made sure to tell us we were not to be in any hurry. But with our breakfast coming out in mere minutes, and the small portions we were done quickly. The line to pay was really long. That was just bad timing on our part. But the line wrapped along the wall, and in front of the kitchen where the servers all come and go with food. It was hectic. Not the greatest experience, but we will give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict. Chose the hash browns.
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. We were about 7th in line to pay. Boo.

gz8q7P5-7HqXCJmLq7Ny2Q.text: Very disappointed with this restaurant today. My friends and family meet every Saturday at Egg Works near Sunset Park. The one time we decide to branch out to the other restaurants and it doesn't start off well at all. Our organizer checked it out a week ago and even called in a reservation for our large group. We get here and they apologize profusely because they allowed a large party of 17 people in just before us and pretty much told us calling in advance for reservations does not do any good. Not professional or organized. Not good for planned large parties, especially parties with several elderly and handicapped members.   If you do want one that will actually honor large planned gatherings, professionally and with organizational skills, one who won't blame your party for their lack of both, then try Egg Works on Sunset. Not good, The Cracked Egg, not good.   I'll update if we ever get a table.  We were seated at 30 min after we arrived and now feeling a little better. The server was very nice and prompt.   Okay, now that I've had coffee and my MIL is comfortable, I'm going to upgrade the rating to 3 stars. Menu looks nice and I'm excited to try the coffee cake.   Food and service was excellent. They don't do muffins like Egg Works, but they do make a very tasty apple cinnamon cream cheese coffee cake. We might try again for our group brunch and we hope it was just a fluke.

Xpzn174BOd8PkswUjsQNnA.text: This place is very near to several other places I do business. So when I saw featured in a "breakfast" edition of Las Vegas Weekly, I made sure to stop in.  The strong suit of this venue is the creativity of its menu. There were no less than seven versions of Eggs Benedict, for example. Pastrami Benedict, Mexican Benedict, Veggie Benedict with Avacado, et. al. The entire menu was extremely diverse for a breakfast joint. There's a lunch/sandwich menu as well.  After that, much credit for customer service. Twice, the BUSBOY stopped to offer refills on my coffee.  My selections were tasty enough. Said another way, the food was of good quality. Not "rock my world" quality, but well above-average.  I think this place best fits, for me, as a morning-after breakfast nook with a lady friend. Solo, I'm still heading for Omelet House, where there are also many choices (though not quite as diverse as here), but the portions are much larger, for about the same price.

Vu703kDtNhFzOFmJX16PpA.text: Very slow service took me 40 minutes for the sever to bring our food order to the table . The taste of the food was ok nothing above average . The wait to pay my check was another 20 minutes . I wouldn't recommend this establishment

dv8XkqA_CF7MGvtvep2TGg.text: I love this place the veggie benny is the best in town and they even customize mine to be just the way I like it and it's always done with a smile. I have lunch with my girlfriends at least once if not twice a week and though the menu is extensive we always have the same thing that's how good it is. Love love love this place :)

V2rdB7QTeFsbueYIPepxOw.text: Okay this is a great place for a quick and casual breakfast. Where I haven't tried everything I am a big fan of the Veggie Benny. The dish is served on traditional English muffins, topped with tomatoes, poached eggs and avocado, smothered in hollandaise. Yet don't forget the Potatoes, these little squares, seem to be deep fried and seasoned yet not quite to perfection, but all the same they are good. I would say that the hollandaise could be thicker. But as a whole this restaurant has a menu with a wide range of traditional breakfast and lunch favorites. This wham bam breakfast joint, is a nice place to go with family and friends in a very relaxed environment, even appropriate for a quick breakfast or lunch for any business oriented outing. This location is definitely going to give the corporate chop shops, IHOP, Denny's, and the Original Pancake House a worthy competitor in the turf war that is breakfast. Surely The Cracked Egg has more of a local, friendly, and welcoming environment than its corporate competitors as well. Please stop by this restaurant and give it a shot. It is at Green valley just off pebble in the smiths parking lot.

v4lMX_0dLKbl3Rv77fU2jQ.text: We have tried the cracked egg twice for breakfast and both times were very average.  The food is very average and the waiters either forgot our order or could not be bothered.  Las Vegas has several great places to eat so good luck.

cCnxACYbh4zEdVopboW8Fw.text: Excellent breakfast place! The huevos rancheros plate is the best.

XbEWYiDVadrd-3NTLCdsHw.text: Ok, its been 3 years since the last visit.  Had breakfast arriving at 6:20 am.  Again hope management or the owner reads this post.  -No one to greet us, waited 5 minutes or so, sat ourselves. -Noticed only one very busy super nice guy named Juan working his butt off. -Within 20 minutes, Juan (by himself, no one else in the dinning room) was handling 14 tables  and over 35 diners by himself.  -More people coming in and no one to set them.  Juan running around trying to accomplish everything....greeting some of the people, running water and coffee, serving, busing, etc.  to now almost 20 tables with over 50 diners...(yes I am counting, my wife told me to stop).  But I was amazed by watching Juan do all these task.    I hope Juan gets paid as a greeter host, server, food runner, bus person, and cashier because he certainly was doing all of these jobs almost seamlessly.   Food prices have increased quite a bit.  Had the Chicken, gravy, eggs, hash browns, toast.  -Eggs were good. -Their gravy is not bad, I would say good...but not as good as Mr Mama's! -Chicken was not good, mostly hard breaded batter.  I remember the chicken as being much better. -HASH BROWNS...well awesome, probably the best that I have had here in town!  This place has so much potential and I really want to like it.  Saves me over 12 miles round trip from going to Mr Mamas (Rated #1 on yelp I believe) on Jones and Russell.  Oh, by 7am a young lady showed up to help Juan, whew!    **********   FIVE STARS TO JUAN!   ***********

RTkJthPRb-ur8VFv7OE6Hg.text: I literally live a block away from the cracked egg so I come here often when I am craving some good breakfast food.  There usually isn't a wait unless it is Saturday or Sunday morning between 8-12.  In that case, the most you usually would have to wait is 30-45 minutes to get a table.    Everything here is very affordable ranging between $7-15 dollars for a large portioned meal.    My favorites at cracked egg:  The Monte Cristo Turkey, ham and swiss cheese sandwich dipped in french toast batter and deep fried. served with hash browns or seasoned potatoes.  This is absolutely amazing and hits so many of your senses that it will confuse you but it is delicious!    Coconut Macadamia Short stacks are a great side to add to any of the meals.  If you are looking for a healthier option, the oatmeal overload is a HUGE bowl of oats, loaded with nuts, raisins, berries, and granola on the side.    Another one of my favorites is The Country Benny:  a biscuit split and topped with patty sausage, two poached eggs and smothered in gravy  Overall, I am a big fan of the cracked egg.  The service has always been friendly and prompt.  The food is good and affordable.

KbEm0n-dUng7TcT4FkAQiw.text: So good! I loved the eggs benny and the potatoes were seasoned perfectly. Service was great as well and I loved the coffee cake. Will definitely be back!

-syuZhDn6iuQ5wQLi8iLdQ.text: 1- kudos for not making it weird that I am a female eating breakfast alone. So many places are so confused when you do this.   2- Coffee was hot. Not tepid, warm, hot. Delicious and hot  3- I got chicken fried steak because, well, I'm on a kick. Hopefully, I break it soon because it's not the best breakfast on the health list, but man, it's sooo good.   4- Price was reasonable, speed was good, and food was delicious.   They have a good menu to choose from with some different items. Normally I try more stuff, but when I get on a kick, nothing can stop me :D It is worth coming in for a nice good breakfast. Friendly staff and I will be back for some other menu items.

_OnoFp4QQz2qwynlrHsh4g.text: This place this amazing! If you can get away from the Strip do so and come here for breakfast or lunch. The chicken fried steak was great and the cakes and eggs combo was good.

I1gCeaN9bFqQPmEl_LQ9uA.text: First time here. Went Sundays of all Sundays-Easter. Didn't even wait 5 mins.   My boyfriend ordered the Montecristo. Very good! I ordered the peanut butter French toast. Very good as well.  Can't wait to be back in the area again, to try something else off of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Monte Cristo on the top. Peanut butter French toast with bananas and honey on the bottom.

9c-i_5G5_m3NfruuqQ_VvQ.text: The hostess staff are friendly and nice.. The service good,, the food served hot and fresh.. I have not had a bad experience or a unsatisfactory meal.. Will be back again

k1ATB0vlncjP4qT127h5Zg.text: We had a nice meal. We were there late morning and it was still doing a brisk business so obviously he has a good following.  My Mom had fruit plate which was fresh and delicious.  My Dad had a Denver omlet, again very tasty. I had a turkey burger with cheese and mushrooms. Great Turkey burger. Good portions hearty meal.

MJvjUD4NC0wUG2UIXpuQew.text: My favorite breakfast joint. Always packed on the weekends but the menu is big and delicious. The skillets are perfect and if you get a half order its even a better value. Their loyalty program coupons make it super affordable. The wait staff is wonderful just wish they had call ahead wait list cause it gets jam packed in there..but for good reason!

Lg4lsV5S2fLIvDokDF6Ssw.text: Great mexican skillet. The chorizo was a great combo with the seasoned potatoes, jalapenos and eggs. I got mine over medium so the yolk makes it a little saucy!   Coffee cake was just ok though. Very sweet and not really flavored like anything. Like a white cake with a little jam on one corner of the bottom. Next time I'll get toast or something.  My breakfast companion had the eggs b. He loved it. I tried a taste and thought the ham was much to smoky for me.  We will definitely go back though.

lqA_woi74-1gWRWgS7iGuw.text: This place is great for breakfast. It's convenient, good service, and good food.   I've been here a couple times and haven't had a bad experience yet. We're always seated quickly, granted we haven't come during peak times on a weekend so I'm not sure how busy that might get. But we've had good service each time, food has been good, some creative items on the menu, but always leave feeling good, satisfied, and loving breakfast all over again. Prices are reasonable, place is clean, I will definitely be returning.

ZfwFpzwhKpHwzCAa-XH8WQ.text: The Cracked Egg. I looked up nearby breakfast places and came across this one. For some reason I felt like eating eggs and how appropriate.  Walked in and was seated pretty quickly. Sat down and was immediately greeted by our server. She quickly let us order our coffee and we browsed the menu. I ordered the Cakes & Eggs Combo while the husband ordered the Huervos Rancheros. Waited for a little bit as the entire restaurant was pretty busy. I like basic breakfast. Nothing heavy or I would have to roll out of the restaurant. Cakes, eggs, and bacon were good. My husband didn't speak for a straight 15 minutes while he was wolfing down his breakfast. We were FULL.  Overall pretty good food and decent prices. Our server was pretty helpful and she didn't stress us to leave even though it was super busy. Nice place to grab breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. huevos rancheros and cakes &amp; eggs combo.

pxxlmVHpGYetHs0bbc0ddw.text: First time here & wasn't disappointed. The room has a bit of an institutional feel but that was easily overlooked. The service was quick & attentive & my raspberry stuffed french toast was wonderful. There was no kids menu, so my son had to order a full price portion that he was never going to eat.  All in all, nothing to write home about, but I won't avoid it in the future either.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Raspberry Stuffed French Toast

nPSZ8LRUMZTRZAzjUOPGuQ.text: Poor management here. We've been waiting an hour for a party of 13, while a they sat an incomplete party of 12 in front of us. Yes they arrived before us but there was only 3 of the 12 sitting and waiting for the other 8 to show up for more than 25 minutes. Probably won't return

aep9YRPxkOVPSEYxUIpg3w.text: I have only eaten here once and it was delicious! My daughter had the mini chicks I think it was called and I built my own burrito. The food was so good and cooked just right. All the drinks we ordered tasted a bit off and they were just normal drinks so I am not sure if it was just their machine. The wait on a Sunday morning wasn't too bad, about 25 minutes. Our server was attentive but not intrusive and all the other staff were friendly as well. The only negative spot was two of the staff were vocal about some disagreement they were having with another staff member. It made it a bit a bit awkward.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

HelpdjHyijb8nCUfACEZoA.text: I love this place! If you are gluten sensitive this is the place for you, they have a great gluten free menu.

pyfPkfuZ3cgzHAdUm_H75A.text: Black Friday breakfast visit.First time ever. There was a small wait for a table because the place was BUSY!. Despite the reviews to the contrary, the staff was pleasant and attentive, without hovering. They asked if we wanted anything else before bringing the check and offered refills when our drinks were just less than half empty.  My friend ordered the Eggs Benny, which she said was good. The hash browns looked and were uncooked, but they were not greasy, so trade off. The eggs could have used slightly more hollandaise sauce, but our server was happy to bring more when asked.  I ordered the Monte Cristo on the servers rec. I was considering the Eggs benny also. It was good but nothing to write about, truly. I would have liked the option being offered, on menu, of jam or syrup. I choose the seasoned potatoes. They were so NOT seasoned. They were barely salted, but hey, not too greasy also. They were also not too crunchy or crispy, lol. But I did eat them, so they were tasty after adding salt and pepper. They just were not what I expected to receive based on the word "Seasoned"  Overall, I will go back and try other menu items. It was clean, the staff was pleasant and efficient, the food tasted good. The prices were reasonable. It is not close to my home, but for those in the area, check this place out if you haven't already.  Why wouldn't you?

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

fFrf1eh6O-0uU8hKMKB3ZQ.text: I love this place!!! Excellent food, excellent service! The people here are always friendly and welcoming. And you will never leave hungry with the portions they serve .

kyeGbGku1JOetilQZ1WJyg.text: I've been to the 215/Rainbow or 215/Green Valley locations 20+ times.  As you can tell, my family and I love this place.  Great food, I love the chicken fried steak and hash browns.  Some family members love the coffee cake and others love the Eggs Benedict.

CpVh8eiWT_X1jCS1__1xhw.text: I finally tried the Cracked Egg yesterday as it is close by and we were starving.  Though it was a tad pricey for what I got, it was a re-creation of something I love at Magnolia Cafe in Austin, and it also had eggs.  I got the skillet, which is the seasoned potatoes, melted jack and cheddar cheese, and 2 eggs any style - then I get to add toppings.  The eggs - poached easy with perfectly runny yolks.  I got tomatillo sauce, scallions (not a choice but still got em), and avocado slices.  This combo just works, and it clogs the arteries too, but it is soooooo delicious.  I also tasted Eric R.'s coffee cake that came with his omelette - it was more like dessert but steaming hot, a welcome change from the cold cake slices at Starbucks.  Only confusing thing is when you walk in, there is a line for the cashier, but no hostess.  It took us awhile to find someone to seat us.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. My skillet creation

Q-0KmJ9T75aGJ9aH7u65Pw.text: Although the place was packed, we were seated in less than 5 min! The server was sweet but she seemed new being she was very shy and quiet. With that aside everything was phenomenal!!!! The food was so fresh and had the perfect spice to it. The coffee cake, guys..... IS TO DIE FOR. Pls get.   Definitely will be coming back!

ONBi_-ygI0gRAnJrLF7wyg.text: Let me start by saying this is a good restaurant however the service and quality in repeat orders, needs work. If you're looking for a tasty brunch spot The Cracked Egg has several options. The restaurant is a little busy for my liking, which also effects the overall service. To avoid this, I have been ordering take out for the past few months. All in all about 20 mins to get your order. I'm a creature of habit so the Country Benny is my go to. When ordering, the gentleman who answers phones on the weekends, usually asks how you want the eggs cooked. Poached. Benny's come with poached runny eggs, anything else is a sin. Fight me.   Each time I get this order, the eggs are unpredictable. While I am not always asked about how I'd like the eggs prepared, that all depends on who takes my order. Will I get hard poached this time? Another fun one is when the two eggs are cooked differently, with one runny and one cooked completely hard. This is disappointing as I can't exactly send it back. I'm also not trying to be the guy examining the food before I take it out of the restaurant.   I'll of course be back because the food really is delicious. But hope all the food that comes out of the kitchen is held to the same caliber, regardless of whether it's eaten in the restaurant or carried out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Over cooked egg on the Country Benny

8df81Xa0NDwXwQu2tSJwiA.text: Scary fast this morning.  Great food and service.  Eggs done properly.  Thank you!  Yelp asked me to make this review longer, so I am adding this test for their benefit.  Yelp, do not tell me how to write a review.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggs over easy, link sausage, hash browns, wheat toast, coffee, water.  Very good food.

GSqRaX-BkAZVoEVS8LYKoQ.text: I spotted this place via yelp and thought it has great reviews so let's give it a try. It's a typical diner, Los fashioned and reminiscent of something you would find in an 80's movie. The staff is friendly and attentive. The huevos rancheros was a top seller so I got it. The hash browns were recommended by the waiter. I eggs were good but I thought they added too much cheese. The salsa is like a something out of a jar. I loved the hash browns though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros with hash browns. It&#39;s okay nothing great. Too cheesy

KKRRZofxSc_AUySrRbxIfA.text: When we first walked in the door,  the hostess/cashier was in the middle of a transaction. No one acknowledged us. Then I asked for a kid's menu stating that my mother was elderly and didn't eat much. After we were seated,  it took nearly 10 minutes before our server noticed us. I proceeded to order when the server said adults were not allowed to order from the kids menu. Why were we not informed of this in the beginning?  Anyway,  the food was mediocre at best and the service was less than desirable. Won't be back.

IpxIFZPLIUfa0GRDgWWK_g.text: One of my go-to places for breakfast/brunch on the weekends. The whole experience definitely differs on the server you have. Some are very attentive, others seem to forget that you even exist. I'm not a huge breakfast fan, so I get the pastrami on rye every time. Sometimes the meat is great, sometimes not so much. Sometimes the bread is good, sometimes not so much. Then you have times like today where half of it was great, and the other half was horrible. Bread was soggy and disgusting. But that first half was delicious! Chances are I'll be back because my daughter loves it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami on Rye.

oqJgfhnwNTyHrV92EvLm5A.text: I've dined here quite a few times, so it's safe to say this place is A-ok in my book. It's your typical sit down breakfast/lunch place with omelets, pancakes, skillets, sandwiches and burgers. The portions are fairly large and the prices are decent. We always have left overs no matter what we order.   I've tried breakfast and lunch items, but honestly nothing really stands out as "wow I need to order this again." The only thing worth mentioning is their COFFEE CAKE! It's served warm and it's so so soft. The flavor changes daily but my favorite has got to be the strawberry or the pumpkin. Even if I order a burger, I will still order me a side of coffee cake, it's that good.   The service is hit or miss. I've had servers who looked happy to be there. However, I've also had servers who hated their lives and it showed. On our last visit, our server seemed to be rushing through the motions. No biggie though. The one thing I'm definitely not a fan of is the waiting area. It can get congested really fast. With customers having to go to the register to pay, that just adds to even more congestion.  I'm not in any rush to eat here again. But I wouldn't be opposed for someone suggested this for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Cracked croissant w/ fruit
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Blue cheese bacon burger w/ an added egg
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Warm, delicious coffee cake

D79P8uFy2ymS11Pkwap8iw.text: Very good breakfast here, French toast is hella yummy! Wife had a ham and cheese omelet was yummy also! Wait staff could smile more! Otherwise would have been 5 stars!

DdOj-0qB0abmmwWkWeSpqQ.text: Lovely little place in the Green Valley part of Henderson. Very popular, I hear wait times are common. They told us 20 minute wait time for a table... It was more like 7-10 min. wait...  That was a nice surprise. The food is good, your standard diner type breakfast and lunch... Except kicked up a notch, 2 of us had breakfast, 2 of us had lunch.  Everyone enjoyed their food. You can get their famous coffee cake as a side... When in Rome... So ordered it... Came out looked okay... Nothing special...Till you took a bite, It was moist and delicious!!  Would I go back or recommend THE CRACKED EGG??  Yes probably, if you want a decent burger, omelette or other diner type food it's worth a try...

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. The coffee cake is as good as advertised...
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Hubby Loved this burger!
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Here you are...

w4-1Kt_78dwbWn3ImKEPPQ.text: I came here to eat with the my kids one morning and we didn't have to wait for a table for 3. The food was decent nothing amazing. I got the Southwest Scramble and I felt like the chorizo could have been drained better as it was very greasy. Our server seemed to just be going through the motions.

157BEJIeCgne58_p0hofXg.text: Plenty of great breakfast places throughout the Las Vegas valley, but this has to be toward the top of the list. Has a nice mix of a "diner" feel while being clean, modern, and having the service experience you'd expect in a regular restaurant. We managed to time our visit just right as we were seated immediately. Since we have kids, it's always nice to have a menu for them to color. They provide colored pencils for kids instead of crayons, so just a heads up if you have little little ones.   My wife ordered the Carnitas omelette. I always hesitate to get things like that because the Carnitas aren't usually authentic and it ends up just being regular pork. In this case, they were perfect. Very flavorful and loaded into the omelette. It's also topped with a healthy amount of sour cream. Very balanced, delicious dish.   I opted for the ham and eggs. The ham steak is huge, well prepped, and goes great with however you take your eggs. We also both got the seasoned potatoes with our meals and they were super good. Sides are always best when they compliment the main dish  and the potatoes do just that. Well seasoned, large portion, and just crispy enough on the outside while staying soft on the inside. Could not be better cooked.   The real kicker of the meal was the coffee cake. Instead of toast or other bread, you can opt for coffee cake with your meal. Since we went in the fall, the coffee cake was pumpkin chocolate chip flavored. It was delicious, light, and humongous. It's a little lighter than a traditional coffee cake, but still very good.   Service was top notch throughout our experience. Even paying our check at the front after we were done was incredibly smooth despite the entrance being packed with people.   Definitely a can't miss experience, even if you're coming from the strip. Well worth the 10-15 minute drive for some great food and prompt service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Ham and Eggs. Simple but still so good.
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. The incredible coffee cake. Fills up a small plate pretty easily.

DNruHA1RyPxBS2l_6SVcXA.text: Great options!  Menu is endless but not overwhelming.  Gluten-free options as well. Dishes are fresh and served hot!  The coffee cake is mouth watering!  Great place to have breakfast and a light lunch.  Children friendly as well.  Very clean and service was fairly quick.  Only room for improvement could be in the friendliness of staff - hence the 4 Stars.  A must try if you are visiting!

iyEp1tTPy_2OJ31AE37B8Q.text: I'm going to give this restaurant five stars mainly because I think their overall rating should be a solid four. We enjoyed good service and delicious food. I ordered the enchilada omelette minus the tortilla chips, and it was delicious. I substituted fresh fruit in place of the hash brown potatoes and it was the perfect way to end my meal.  We arrived around 9 AM on Saturday morning and we were seated right away. By the time we left there were a lot of people waiting for a table. I recommend this restaurant for a great breakfast, and we will come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States

MAC-48MuNKQjlsjD4EUeBw.text: Good food, good service. Expect a short wait. If you're looking for ambiance, forget about it. It's like eating on a basketball court with time running out. Nearly impossible to carry on a conversation without screaming at each other. The owners would do well to install a ceiling.

0nZlkrjIDZ7F9qIkMiI9vg.text: Nothing wrong with the food here--breakfast staples done right. Service seemed lacking.

lVD0saXnORxFuZxdxpg2Tg.text: Service fabulous but quality of food  just Ok We always had a great experience but food was so so

eebiMVzUsbZJR9Wgy9lGfg.text: It was decent. Portions a little small for the price or I might be spoiled by the omelet house. Coffee cup emptied a couple times The eggs were cooked properly and the corn beef hash was nicely not from a can.  Food tasted good, service was okay. Mary have to try again some day

VISONJuZ7y95FizqqQyHFw.text: Sometimes there is that special place that you always want to go. You might now go there all the time. But when you do, you feel like you can indulge yourself.  Well, this is it.  Is it the best looking place from the outside? No Is it the nicest looking place inside? No Is the food and service best and nicest? Hell yeah!!! Coming from L.A., I know a thing or two about going out to eat, and this place is perfect. No snobs here, just good food, good prices and huge portions.  They could cut the size down by a third and you would still have enough for two to share a plate.  And our server, Chelsea was great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. So good, there was nothing left ;)

SmzLLF_qTGWK6Ohb8IKhKA.text: In the neighborhood early and hungry so we stopped in for my favorite breakfast when it's done properly, Veggie Bennie. It was prepared really well, the English muffin was toasted & crispy as it should be, every eggs Benedict needs the texture of a crispy muffin. They were spot on with medium poached eggs and extremely generous with the spinach & avocado. My holding back on the five star review was that the hollandaise sauce was just not as acid as it should be, needed more lemon & had a sweetness that was a bit off putting. The hash browns were just okay, a tad greasy for me. My friend ordered eggs scrambled with cream cheese and a veggie and she thoroughly enjoyed it. She had coffee and said it was also very good. Bottom line for me is the Veggie Bennie will always keep me coming back and our server, Cynthia was attentive and very courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Busy full dining room
Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. Veggie Bennie

w3BhschBFcCvIjwPj2UYpg.text: This is the best breakfast place in Vegas. The coffee cake is a must! The flavor is different everyday.  The scramblers are awesome. My favorite is the sweet potato scramble. Large portions, don't be afraid to share with a friend.  Their coffee is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cracked Egg - Henderson, NV, United States. The coffee cake is to die for!

1ihnBHMAwGfCD66O4KOW_w.text: You need to try their coffee cake. It's so good!!! Great Breakfast & Brunch spot. Love the cafe style atmosphere. Always busy on a Sunday after church. Very homey, and relaxed. Food is yummy. The skillets are a must-try. I have yet to try the pancakes or french toasts...maybe during our next stop I will.
